Doña Norma el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  maní.  Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercancía que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos y con esto mejorar la situación  económica. 
Doña Norma  espera que  a un corto plazo   su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la región y seguir  apoyando a su familia y sus hijos  se conviertan en personas honesta  con principios y valores.




Choluteca, Honduras –  Febrero  del   2013
texts.en:
Sra. Norma is an enterprising, honest, and serious individual. She lives with her husband and three children in southern Honduras. Her business involves buying and selling seeds.

Doña Norma needs this loan to buy peanuts. She hopes the loan will increase her business sales since she will have more merchandise to offer to her customers and provide for their needs. As a result, her economic situation should improve.

In the short term, Doña Norma hopes that her business will continue growing and eventually become larger and more recognized in the region. She wants to continue supporting her family so that her children will become honest people with principles and values.

Choluteca, Honduras – February 2013

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Cumbe  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cumbe esta formado por 7 mujeres quienes son vecinas y amigas, viven por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar de goza de una arquitectura moderna y  antigua, sus campos verdes son el fruto de la agricultura, su geografía es accidentada con hermosos paisajes. Su gente es amable, gentil y de un corazón cálido que luchan para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares y entregarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ruth, tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 10, 8 y 4 años, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 

Doña Ruth  trabaja de domingo a domingo y sin un horario fijo como empleada domestica, actividad que la realiza en diferentes casas, en el tiempo que le queda libre se dedica a la crianza de pollos a los mismos que los vende vivos o pelados. También cultiva sus terrenos y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en el alimento para animales. 

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The community bank Cumbe is made up of seven women who are all friends and neighbors and who live in the parish of Cumbe within the city of Cuenca. This area is well known for its unique mix of traditional and modern architecture, as well as for its green, fertile fields and beautiful countryside. The people who live in the region are kind, peaceful and dedicated to their work and families. Everyone in the area works very hard to provide a bright future for their children and loved ones.

One of the group members, Ruth, is 29 years old and is a single mother to three children, ages 10, 8 and 4. Her two oldest children are in elementary school, and Ruth and her kids are currently renting a place to live, as they do not own their own home. Ruth works seven days a week on a variable schedule as a household maid in several homes. In her limited free time, she operates a side business raising chickens for resale. Ruth also tends small plots of land to grow crops and food to feed her family. 

Ruth plans to use the support from this loan to purchase chickens and feed for her birds in hopes of strengthening her business. Her goal is to one day own her own home.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and feed for her birds.

loans.name: Elsa Ydalinda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres De Riobamba.

En este lugar vive la señora Elsa, tiene 59 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos mayores de edad, el menor de ellos vive en su casa. El marido es pintor.
 
Doña Elsa  con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio y también trabaja en una boutique del cual percibe un sueldo mensual. Ella vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta,  aprovecha las noches y fines de semana para realizar estos recorridos por la ciudad. Es así como gana algo extra ya que en el hogar hay muchos gastos y a su esposo no le alcanza con lo que gana, ella  deja a   crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días, lo que más vende son jeans tanto de hombres como de mujeres.  Su mercadería  la compra en  Guayaquil o le mandan desde Quito.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones jeans, camisetas y blusas. Ella es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos en relación a otras instituciones financieras.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para poder trasladarse y realizar sus ventas de una manera más cómoda.
texts.en:
The members of Mujeres de Riobamba Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, known as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

This is where Elsa lives.  She's 59 years old and has a common-law marriage from which she has seven adult children, the youngest of whom lives in her house.  Her husband's a painter.

Elsa makes a living as a merchant so she can earn her own money to help her husband with the household expenses.  She also works in a boutique, where she receives a monthly salary.

She sells clothing door-to-door, taking advantage of the evenings and weekends to go around in the city.  This is how she earns a little extra because she has a lot of household expenses, and what her husband earns isn't enough.  She leaves things with her customers on credit and collects every two weeks.  What she sells most are jeans, for both men and women.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil or has it sent from Quito.

This loan is to buy jeans, t-shirts, and blouses.

She's a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because the interest is low compared to other financial institutions.  Her dream is to have a car to be able to get around and make her sales more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, and blouses

loans.name: Lisbeth Carina

texts.es:
La socia Lisbeth pertenece al banco “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.  

La socia sigue trabajando como docente del nivel primario en uno de los colegios de Cusco a la vez la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien graciasd al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma poder seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como arroz,azucar entre otros.

La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar con sus actividades económica las cuales representan el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Lisbeth is a member of the community bank, "The Leaders," which is located in the city of Cuzco, Peru. Lizbeth continues her work as an elementary school teacher at a public school in Cuzco, and also operates a general store on the side. She believes business is going well at her store because she is extremely dedicated to her work and to her clients' needs. She plans to continue working both of her jobs, as they help her to support her family. 

Lisbeth is requesting this loan in order to purchase merchandise to stock her general store, including rice, sugar and many other products for resale. She is very grateful to Kiva for this opportunity to continue working and providing for her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as rice, sugar and other items to stock her general store.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам проживает в районе Конибодом. Ему 53 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Рустам занимается торговлей. Два года как Рустам открыл продуктовый магазин. Он приобрел холодильники и закупил продукты для продажи. Сейчас Рустаму необходимо увеличить товарооборот. У него небольшой ассортимент товара. Для того чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара, ему необходимо закупить молочные продукты, колбасные, кондитерские, хлебобулочные изделия и другие продукты.
texts.en: Rustam lives in the Konibodom region. He is 53 years old, married, and has 2 children. He works in retail. Two years ago, he opened a grocery store. He bought refrigerators and groceries to sell, and now he has to increase his turnover. He currently carries a modest assortment of goods in his shop. To expand the range of groceries he offers, he needs to purchase dairy products, sausages, candy, baked goods, and other products.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products, sausages, candy, baked goods, and other groceries to increase the range of products he sells

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Ms. Riffat is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. For the past 20 years, with the support of her husband, Riffat has been running a business of selling milk. She is pictured with her husband.  

She initiated her business by buying a buffalo to support her family. At this time, her husband was the only breadwinner. With the passage of time, her sales and income increased. Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. 

Her success is the result of her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, including financial ones. While talking to the Kashf Foundation officer, she shared her feeling of achievement from sending her son to college for further studies. 

Riffat has some savings and has applied for a PKR 30,000 loan to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf Foundation for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Ghulam-Fatima

texts.en:
Ms. Ghulam-Fatima is a 55-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide them with a beautiful life that includes good education, food, and clothing.  

She has been in the business of selling milk for many years. She makes enough money to contribute to her family's income. Ms. Ghulam-Fatima contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 in order to purchase an additional buffalo. She hopes to increase her milk production capacity, with the ultimate goal of generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase an additional buffalo.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a married woman and a mother of four children. Four years ago, she started her own laundry business at her home. Her sons also assist her in running her business. She has a good client list. Most of her clients are her neighbors and she earns handsome money from her business. 

Salma has gradually improved her business and now she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000. She is going to use this loan to buy another washing machine to cater to more customers without fail. She intends to use the earned profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy another washing machine to cater to more customers without fail.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Ms. Sabah is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the past four years. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list.  She makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

Sabah is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy a stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet with the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and part to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Marianita De Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocido como La Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad bella y hospitalaria, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Damas De Progreso.

En este lugar vive la señora Marianita, tiene 64 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa a pesar de que ya están comprometidos. Su esposo trabaja en una universidad de la localidad.
 
Doña Marianita además de ser una gran ama de casa y madre de familia también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y joyas de fantasía, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres o cuatro días por semana ya sea en las tardes o en las mañanas y cuando sus clientes necesitan algo, aunque sus clientes también la visitan en su casa cuando necesitan de alguna prenda,  ella deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días o en quincena, lo que es mercadería lo va a comprar cada vez que necesita a Guayaquil o a Quito, lleva más de  20 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y  joyas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido ir mejorando su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The members of Damas de Progreso Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the San Cristóbal community of the city of Portoviejo, a beautiful and hospitable city known as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

This is where Marianita lives.  She's 64 years old and married, and from this relationship has four adult children, two of whom still live in her house despite being engaged already.  Her husband works in a university in the town.

Marianita makes a living as a merchant as well as being a great housewife and mother.  She sells all types of clothes and costume jewelry.  She sells door-to-door and works three or four days a week, either in the afternoon or the morning or when her customers need something.  Her customers also go to her house when they need some garment.  She leaves things on credit and charges every week or two.  She goes to Guayaquil or Quito to buy merchandise when she needs it.  She has been in this business for more than 20 years and it's going very well for her.

She's going to use this loan to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and jewelry.

She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because she has been able to keep on improving her business with the loans.  Her dream is to have a car to make her sales.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and jewelry

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо 40 лет. Она замужем и мать четверых детей. Она со своей семьей проживает в районе Шахритус, расположенный в юго-западной части Таджикистана. Муж Мархабо работает в джамоате секретарем. Джамоат - это орган самоуправлнения в поселке и селе. Мархабо тоже наравне с мужем трудится и обеспечивает семью. Вот уже два года как она занимается животноводством. Мархабо покупает коров и телят, откармливает их в течение нескольких месяцев и затем продает с наценкой на скотном рынке. Сейчас Мархабо запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи курпнорогатого скота с целью расширения своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Marhabo is 40 years old, married, and has 4 children. She and her family live in the Shahrituz region in the south-western area of Tajikistan. Her husband works as a secretary in the Jamoat, which is the municipal administrative body of their village. Marhabo works as hard as her husband does to provide for the family. For the last 2 years, she has been raising cattle. She buys cows and calves, fattens them for several months, then sells them for a profit at the cattle market. Marhabo is now seeking a loan to purchase and sell cattle for the purpose of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms. Razia is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family and provide for a better future. 

Two years ago, Ms. Razia began stitching work in her home. She sews for people living near her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of funds she is unable to meet her customer's daily demands. She has requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase more spools of thread and packets of buttons, lace, and zippers in various colors. 

Ms. Razia is in her fourth loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She dreams of providing her children with a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread and packets of buttons, lace, and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Ms. Kousar is 55 years old and married. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing her stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

Kousar wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Ms Rukhsana is 26 years old, a married woman and a mother of two children. She has been successfully running a business of bed sheets selling for many years with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Rukhsana’s husband.  By this time, they have many customers and make enough to lead a decent life. 

Rukhsana wants to purchase more bed covers and bed sheets to grow her sales. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She has been in association with Kashf for four years and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the revenue on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of bed covers and bed sheets to grow her sales.

loans.name: Bertha Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocido como La Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad bella y hospitalaria, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Damas De Progreso.

En este lugar vive la señora Bertha, tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad pero dos de ellos viven en su casa además de un nieto de 9 años que estudia en escuela.

Para ganarse el sustento diario Doña Bertha se dedica al comercio, desde hace mas de 7 años vende dulces, mangos, grosellas en funditas con sal, ciertas golosinas y bocadillos elaborados, ella se desplaza en un triciclo por los lugares donde se reúnen las personas,  sobre todo a la salida de ciertas escuelas y colegios ya que estos son sus mejores clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 17h30, su nieto le ayuda en su labor cuando él está desocupado, es así como ella con su esfuerzo sale adelante honradamente.
  
Este crédito es para comprar mangos, golosinas, bocadillos, grosellas y varios productos que ella vende. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cinco años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the members of the communal bank Damas de Progreso get together in the citadel of San Cristóbal in the beautiful and welcoming city of Portoviejo (aka La Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos). 

Bertha, a 50-year old woman and single mother of 4 children, lives in this city. Her children are already adults, but two of them live in her house together with her 9-year old grandson who attends school. Bertha has been working in retail for 7 years and makes a living from selling sweets, mangoes, redcurrants sold in cases with salt, and some elaborated candy and sandwiches. She uses a tricycle to go to places where people meet, such as the entrance of some schools, where she has her best customers. She works every day from 6.30am to 5.30pm and her grandson helps when he's available. This is how she gets ahead with effort and honesty. 

She will use the requested loan to buy mangoes, candy, sandwiches, redcurrants and other products that she sells. She's been a member of the communal bank for 5 years and likes it for the help she gets with the loans. Her dream is to keep getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, candy, sandwiches, redcurrants, etc.

loans.name: Orlando Jesús

texts.es: El señor Orlando Jesus G.F, habita en el Municipio de Ticuantepe en la comunidad llamada la Francia junto a su esposa e hijos, ella es comerciante y le ayuda con los gastos del Hogar, el cultiva Piña desde hace mas de 10 años gracias a su trabajo a mejorado sus condiciones de vida, con este nuevo credito don Orlando comprara Insumos y Fertilizantes necesarios para un optimo mantenimiento a sus cultivo ya que la plaga y el mal clima esta afectando su cosecha. Agradece el apoyo de parte de Afodenic y Fondos Kiva durante todos estos años.
texts.en:
Orlando Jesús G. F. lives with his wife and children in the La Francia community in the town of Ticuantepe.  His wife, a merchant, helps him with the household expenses.  He has grown pineapple for more than 10 years.  Thanks to his job he has improved his living conditions.

With this new loan Orlando will buy the necessary supplies and fertilizer for optimal crop maintenance because pests and bad weather are affecting his harvest.

He's grateful to AFODENIC and Kiva for their help all these years.

loans.use: to keep his crop in good condition

loans.name: Saddam Addel Harum

texts.es: Saddam es un joven emprendedor de 22 años de edad que le gusta mucho el negocio, su esposa labora en su propio negocio de comida rápida ambos tienen muchos deseos de superación, Saddam tiene realizada su carrera de ingeniería en sistemas y también en automotriz pero por la falta de empleo se ha inclinado mas por las ventas de repuestos para motos, negocio que le es muy rentable, en la actualidad no tiene hijos aun, su meta es seguir creciendo y poner otro puesto de venta en el mercado, por esta razón solicita este primer rédito para invertir en el negocio comprando repuestos varios, llantas y rines para motos, asi ir aumentando el inventario poco a poco.
texts.en:
Saddam, 22, is a young entrepreneur who very much likes business.  His wife works in her own fast-food business.  They both have a great desire for self-improvement.

Saddam completed his studies in systems engineering as well as in automotive engineering.  Owing to a lack of work, however, he has tended more towards selling motorcycle parts, a business that is very profitable for him.

Currently he still doesn't have any children.  His goal is to continue growing and set up another sales stall in the market.

This is why he's requesting his first loan to invest in his business by buying a variety of spare parts, tires, and rims for motorcycles.  This way he'll keep on increasing his inventory little by little.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, tires, and rims for motorcycles

loans.name: Zul'finiso

texts.ru: Зульфинисо проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 63 года. Она вдова. У нее двое дочерей, они замужем. Сама Зульфинисо пенсионерка. Она рядом с домом занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Зульфинисо в этой области несколько лет. Она берет кредит для покупки газированных напитков, сухариков, печенья, шоколада и конфет, чтобы увеличить оборот а также для лечения.
texts.en: Zul'finiso lives in Khujand. She is 63 and divorced. She has two daughters; they are both married. Zul'finiso herself is retired. She sells groceries just outside her home, and has been involved in this type business for several years. She has asked for a loan to purchase carbonated drinks, crackers, cookies, chocolate and candy to increase sales, as well as to pay for her medical treatment.

loans.use: to purchase carbonated drinks, crackers, cookies, chocolate and candy to increase sales, as well as to pay for her medical treatment.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Growing up, Elmer’s favorite place to eat was the local pizzeria. Before he was old enough to work, Elmer knew he wanted to “throw” pizzas for a living.  Elmer started out working at larger pizza chains and was able to work his way up to superb local pizzerias.  Elmer quickly learned the skills and techniques and became a pizzaiolo, specializing in carefully crafting pizzas.  

Elmer’s work ethic comes from his motivation to provide for himself and his family.  As a teenager working in pizza shops, his hard work meant independence and the ability to start a new life. Today, Elmer is ready to take his experience and passion and start his own business, Coney Island Pizzeria. 
 
The pizzeria has seen five previous owners in the last four years, but Elmer is determined to create a lasting community pizzeria. Coney Island Pizzeria reopened March 1, and Elmer is already starting to establish quality relationships with customers and new regulars.

For Elmer, making pizza is a labor of love.  His passion is creating quality pizza using the best ingredients, and his goal is to create a safe and fun community pizzeria for families.  Over the last 15 years, Elmer has developed arthritis in his hands.  Although very painful, it didn't stop him from doing what he loves to do and achieving his dreams.

A loan through Kiva will enable Elmer to create a welcoming and comfortable environment for his guests.  It will also allow him to finish necessary renovations and updates to breathe new life into the pizzeria.  Elmer hopes to one day expand his pizzeria to other locations and share his commitment to building positive, fun restaurants in the community.

After making a loan, make sure to buy a pizza from this local hotspot: www.coneyislandpizzeria.com

video.title: Kiva Borrower Elmer from United States

loans.use: to pay for renovations and updates to his pizzeria

loans.name: Violeta María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

La señora Violeta Tiene 51 años de edad, hace algún tiempo atrás su esposo falleció y de esa relación tiene cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad y una linda chiquilla de 17 años la cual estudia en colegio, tres de ellos aun viven con ella.

Para salir adelante Doña Violeta y para que no le falte nada a su familia se dedica al comercio, vende aliños y especias, también vende sobrecamas, carteras, ropa entre otras cosas, tiene un pequeño local en el cual vende un día a la semana ya que los otros días se desplaza a otras ciudades a las diferentes ferias que hay en esos pueblos, los productos los compran en Santo Domingo. Se dedica hace varios años a la venta de sabanas y carteras pero lleva tres años con el negocio de los aliños, empezó su negocio con los créditos de la Fundación Espoir por lo cual esta agradecida por que esto le esto deja bunas ganancias.
 
Este crédito es para comprar aliños, carteras, sabanas, ropa entre otras cosas. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le brindan en el banco.

Su sueño es que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the communal bank "La Inmaculada" meets in Tosagua. The city is known as a very dynamic location where most of the inhabitants are involved in agriculture and live-stock farming because of the lush vegetation.

Violeta, 51, became a widow some time ago.  She has four children: three adults and a 17-year-old daughter still in school.  Three of them live at home.

In order to provide for her family and get ahead, Violeta is a merchant and sells spices and seasonings.  She also sells bedspreads, bags and clothing, among other things.  She has a small stall where she sells once a week, since the rest of the week she goes to markets in other cities.  She buys her merchandise in Santo Domingo.  For several years she has been selling sheets and bags but three years ago she began selling dressings.  She started her business with loans from Fundacion Espoir and she is very grateful because of the good profits.

This loan is to buy seasonings, bags, sheets and clothing.  She is a founding member of her communal bank.  She likes the help she receives from the group.

Her goal is for her daughter to become a professional.

loans.use: To buy seasonings, bags, sheets, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Freddy Guillermo

texts.es: Freddy es un joven de 27 años de edad, vive con su pequeña familia, esposa e hijo de tres meses de nacido, el trabaja como técnico en electrónica, con sus ingresos desea cambiar el techo de la casa pero para esto necesita el crédito e ir pagando en cuotas pequeñas su préstamo, con el cual comprara laminas de zinc, perlines y pagar la mano de obra, de esa manera evitara que en invierno se meta el agua a su casa, gracias a este primer financiamiento. Quedando todavía pendientes otras mejoras que aún le faltan como darle fino a las paredes entre otros, que solo con el tiempo lo irá haciendo poco a poco.
texts.en:
Freddy is a 27-year old young man who lives with his small family: his wife and 3-month old son. He works as an electronic technician and wants to use part of what he earns to change his house ceiling. However, he needs a loan and to pay back in small installments. He will use the requested loan to buy zinc layers ans assembly pieces, and to pay wages. 

His goal with this first loan is to prevent the water to filter into the house in the winter. He would still have other pending improvements, such as repairing the walls, that he'll be doing little by little.

loans.use: to buy zinc layers and assembly pieces, and to pay wages.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah has expertise in hand-embroidery and stitching clothes; she has been using her skills to provide for her family for over two years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required materials. Today she is proud to be famous in her community for her fine stitching. She knows the techniques of stitching very well and makes enough to contribute to the family income.  

Currently Farah is requesting a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase a better sewing machine and spools of thread in various colors. She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time, and satisfying them is a challenge that Farah has taken up.

loans.use: to purchase a better sewing machine and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Jeerling Raquel

texts.es: La señora Jeerling habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo e hijo, ella es comerciante de Ropa de segunda y su esposa le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que trabaja por cuanta propia, su mayor sueño es terminar de construir su casa, y comprar los materiales que necesita. con este nuevo aumentara un poco en su negocio de Ropa ya que la demanda de parte de los clientes es muy buena y quiere aprovechar las vacaciones para colocar su venta. y asi obtener mejores ingresos para invertir mas en su casa. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han  Brindado.
texts.en:
Jeerling lives in the municipality of Tucuantepe with her husband and son. She is a merchant who sells second-hand clothing and her husband, who also works, helps her with household expenses.

Jeerling's biggest dream is to finish constructing her house and to buy the materials that she needs to do so. 

With this new loan, her clothing business will expand a little, since customer demand is very good and she wants to take advantage of vacation time to boost her sales. Thus, Jeerling will obtain better income and be able to invest more in her house.

Jeerling is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for the help they have offered.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Ms. Fozia is a 30-year-old married woman. She is successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house with the support of her husband. She offers various everyday goods at reasonable prices and earns enough money through her business. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock from the market at wholesale rates, as he has made and maintained many contacts over the years. Fozia is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and healthcare. 

In order to fully stock her store, Fozia has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, oils and beverages. In this way she will be able to cater to her customers without fail. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, oils and beverages.

loans.name: Las Obreras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS OBRERAS”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jhenny es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de deportivos por mayor, servicio de transporte, venta de productos por catálogos, taller de mecánica, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de ropa, salón de peluquería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jhenny es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana mayor hace tres años y en la actualidad mejora su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cosméticos) que adquirirá de las personas distribuidoras, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud.
texts.en:
The A.C. "LAS OBRERAS" will start its forth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Villa Adela. The group is made of 8 members and led by a managing team, where Jhenny is the Treasurer. There are different businesses represented in the communal association: wholesale of sport footwear, transportation services, catalog sale, mechanic garage, grocery store, food retail, clothing store and hair salon. 

The requested loan will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs like Jhenny. She has been part of Pro Mujer for 1 year, when a friend invited her. She currently owns a business selling cosmetics, something that she learned from her older sister 3 years ago, and works to improve it. She will use the loan to increase her assets by buying cosmetics in bulk from her suppliers that she will then sell in her store. This is how she makes a living and supports her family (she's married and has a son). 

When asked about Pro Mujer and why she likes it, she replies that she likes its capabilities in the health arena.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Fidelina Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Fidelina es una persona muy emprendedora, vive  con sus 5 hijos en una comunidad en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta  de refrescos y  cosméticos. 
Doña Fidelina el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de refrescos, lociones cremas, talcos, desodorantes, sombras, glases, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer a los clientes.
Doña Fidelina espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo y se convierta en uno de  los  negocios más grandes y reconocidos de  su  colonia y poderle dar los estudios a sus hijos para que se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida. 	




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Febrero  del   2013
texts.en:
Fidelina is a very enterprising person.  She lives with her five children in a community in southern Honduras.  Her business is selling soft drinks and cosmetics.

Fidelina needs the loan to buy soft drinks, lotions, creams, talc, deodorants, shadows, and nail polish, etc.  With the loan, she hopes that the sales in her business increase upon having more products to offer her customers.

Fidelina hopes to cover her necessities and to improve a little her quality of life and that of her family.  In a few years she hopes that her business  continues growing and becomes one of the biggest and most well-known in her neighborhood.  She hopes to be able to give her children an education so that they become good people with better life opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras – February 2013

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.ru: Комилжон житель района Шахритус, расположенный в юго-западной части Таджикистана. Ему 31 год. У него жена и один ребенок. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Дехканское хозяйство это небольшое индивидуальное или коллективное частное хозяйство, в котором работают несколько людей и где в основном выращивают хлопок, пшеницу или овощи - которые занимают 60% орошаемых земель в Таджикистане. Сам Комилжон вот уже 6 лет как занимается растениеводством. У него имеется земельный участок, где он в основном выращивает пшеницу. В сезон посева Комилжон уже посеял пшеницу и теперь для обработки земли ему необходимы минеральные удобрения. С этим намерением он обратился за кредитом. Комилжон просит кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений. За счет прибыли с урожая Комилжон хочет сделать ремонт в доме и улучшить условия проживания.
texts.en: Komiljon lives in the Shahrituz region in the south-western area of Tajikistan. He is 31 years old, married, and has 1 child. His wife is employed in the dekhan farming sector, which is a system of small private farms owned by individuals or groups and worked by several people, where the main crops produced are cotton, wheat, or vegetables, and which accounts for 60% of arable land use in Tajikistan. For the past 6 years, Komiljon has been growing crops. He has a plot of land where he mainly grows wheat. In this planting season he seeded wheat, and now he needs mineral fertilizers in order to work his land. For this reason, he is seeking a loan to purchase these fertilizers. He wants to use the profit generated by his harvest to renovate his house and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Muhammadjon

texts.ru: Мухаммадчону 28 лет. Он женат, но не имеет детей. Он по профессии строитель и несколько лет работал в частной строительной фирме. Данное время он работает в Институт Предпринимательство и сервиса. Его новая работа очень нравится ему. Он работает с удовольствием. Его зарплата хватает на жизнь. Его семья живет в достатке, однако он должен отремонтировать квартиру, на что не хватает его зарплата. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1200 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов, как краска, клей, обои, цемент и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ему улучшить условию проживания и таким образом принесет радость и уют в его доме.
texts.en: Muhammadjon is 28 years old.  He is married, but does not have children.  He is a construction worker by profession and worked for several years at a private construction firm. Right now he works at the Institute of Entrepreneurship and Services.  He likes his new job a lot.  He is happy to work.  His salary is enough for his life.  His family lives in prosperity but he needs to repair his flat, which his salary does not cover.  He is asking for a loan of 1,200 US dollars for the purchase of building materials such as paint, glue, wallpaper, cement, etc.  He is waiting for your kindness.  This loan will allow him to improve his living conditions and bring happiness and comfort to his home.

loans.use: to buy paint, cement, wall paper to repair flat

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба замужняя женщина с четырьмя детьми. Ей 40 лет. Она жительница района Кубадиён, расположенный в южной части Таджикистана. Муж Насибы работает мастером по ремонту домов. Сама Насиба работает учительницей в средней школе. Одновременно Насиба занимается животноводством. Она занята в этой сфере уже более трех лет. Она закупает коров и телят, откармливает их несколько месяцев и затем продает с наценкой. Сейчас Насиба запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи мелко-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Nasiba is a married woman with four children.  She is 40 years old.  She is a resident of the Qubadiyon area in the southern part of Tajikistan.  Nasiba's husband works as a construction worker repairing homes.  Nasiba works as a high school teacher.  Simultaneously Nasiba raises livestock.  She has been in this business for over three years.  She buys cows and calves, fattens them for several months and then sells them at a profit.  Now, Nasiba is asking for a loan for the purchase and resale of small horned livestock.

loans.use: to buy and sell small horned livestock

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea, 50 years old, is a humble man and married, with two grown children. Chea has received three loans from Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) already. He really appreciates that he was able to gain access to financial support with a suitable interest rate at the times he was in need. He found that the loans were very useful and enabled him to continuously develop his living conditions. Now Chea just stays at home and does some housework, being a responsible father and also helps his wife selling breakfast in a market of his region.

To help him start up a new business, Chea is requesting a fourth loan in order to buy a motorbike for traveling sales. He wants to link this motorbike with a trailer at the side, to sell meatballs and soft drinks. He is confident that he can improve his family’s income through the loan help. Chea thanks funders for lending him this money.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for traveling sales.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Ms. Mumtaz is a 24-year-old married woman and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for six years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When she was not earning, her family went through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family, and due to limited resources none of their children were sent to school. Mumtaz felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. 

Mumtaz is a brave woman and her hard work helped her establish a good client list, but she was having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. That’s then she decided to borrow from Kashf. She has requested a loan for 25,000 PKR, which will be used to purchase a new sewing machine and some spools of thread in various colors.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy lard, rice, beans, beef, chicken, sugar, soft drinks, water, toilet paper, salsa, pasta, etc., for her store.

loans.name: Golondrinas Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedora una de ellas es Yamileth tiene 37 años de edad, acompañada tiene 8 años de tener una pulpería en su domicilio, de ser cliente de la institución tiene 4 años puntual y responsable en sus pagos, anteriormente su ocupación es ser ama de casa, los logros personales que alcanzo con el crédito anterior fueron realizo mejoras de su vivienda con el cambio de techo, pintura, embaldoso el local donde tiene su negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de carnes de res, carne de pollo, mortadela, productos lácteos, compra de una vitrina de vidrio para comprar sandalias, sus metas y sueños es tener su distribuidora de abarrotes. Carolina tiene 23 años de edad tiene una pulpería en su domicilio y Rebeca tiene una pulpería y hace y vende tortillas.
texts.en:
Yamileth is a 37-year old woman and member of a group made of three entrepreneurs. She lives with her life partner and has run a grocery store in her house for 8 years now (she was a housewife before). 

She's been a client of the institution for 4 years and has always been punctual and responsible in her payments. Thanks to her previous loan, she was able to make improvements to her house by changing the ceiling, painting and tiling the area where she has her business. She will use the requested loan to buy beef and chicken meats, mortadella, dairy products and a display cabinet to sell sandals. Her goal and dream is to have her own groceries distribution business. 

Carolina is 23 years old and owns a grocery store in her house. Rebeca also owns a grocery store and makes and sells tortillas.

loans.use: to buy grains such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, chicken, beef, mortadella, dairy products and a display cabinet to sell sandals.

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали житель района Шахритус, расположенный в южной части Таджикистана. Ему 35 лет. У него жена и четверо детей. Сафарали более трех лет занимается животноводством. Он покупает коров и телят, откармливает их несколько месяцев и затем продает с наценкой на скотном рынке. Сейчас Сафарали запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота. За счет прибыли он планирует устроить торжество по случаю обрезания младшего сына.
texts.en: Safarali is a resident of the Shahrituz area located in the southern part of Tajikistan.  He is 35 years old.  He has a wife and four children.  Safarali has been raising livestock for more then three years.  He buys cows and calves, fattens them for several months and then sells them for a profit at the livestock market.  Right now Safarali is asking for a loan for the purchase and sale of cattle.  He plans to use the profits to throw a party celebrating the circumcision of his youngest son.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Fuente De Vida 1 Group

texts.es:
La señora Alejandra de estado civil es unida de hecho, tiene 38 años de edad, curso los 6 años de educacion primaria, tiene 6 hijos y de ellos 4 estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la compra, crianza y venta de cerditos y aves de corral, inició este negocio por iniciativa propia y hasta la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia; también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es comerciante.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de cerditos, aves de corral y concentrado para dichos animales, en el futuro quiere tener una granja de gallinas ponedoras y tener mas cerdos. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la compra, crianza y venta de aves de corral.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 38 years old and lives with her partner. She went as far as sixth grade in school. She has six children, and four of them are going to school. She buys, raises and sells pigs and poultry. 

She started this business through her own initiative, and to date has 10 years of experience. She also has the support of her partner who is a merchant.

She is organizing a group to be able to apply for a loan that she will use to buy pigs, poultry, and feed concentrate for these animals. In the future she wants to have a chicken farm with laying hens, and to have more pigs. The other members of the group buy, raise and sell poultry.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Petrona

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa forma parte del banco comunal 10 de Agosto desde hace 10 años. Vive por la parroquia de Santa Ana en Cuenca lugar que gracias a su geografía accidentada tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, desde su centro parroquial se puede admirar la ciudad de Cuenca. Su gente tiene un corazón cálido, son amables y trabajan en diferentes actividades que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares.

La Señora Rosa tiene 31 años, es casada, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 12 y 10 años y un bebé de 2 meses de edad, su primera hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y su segundo hijo en una escuelita. Su esposo se dedica a la dura tarea de laborar como albañil, la casa en la que vive es de propia.

Doña Rosa labora tres días a la semana como empleada domestica, trabaja medio día y el resto de su tiempo lo dedica a su casa y también en la cría de pollos.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento para animales.

Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa has been a member of "10 de Agosto" communal bank for 10 years. She lives in the Santa Ana parish of Cuenca; a place which thanks to its geographic location has many places where you can enjoy nature. From the parish centre, you can admire the city of Cuenca. It's people are warm-hearted, friendly and work in different activities which allow them to pay their household costs.

Rosa is 31 years old, married and has 3 children aged 12, 10 and a 2 months old baby. Her first daughter studies in the town's high school and her son in junior school. Her husband has the difficult job of being a bricklayer. They own their house. 

Rosa works three days a week as a domestic maid. She works half a day and spends the rest of the time looking after her home and chickens.

She is going to invest her new loan in buying chickens and animal feed.

Her aim is to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy chickens and animal feed

loans.name: María Graciela

texts.es:
La Señora María se encuentra realizando su segundo crédito en el banco comunal 10 de Agosto. Vive por la parroquia de Santa Ana en Cuenca lugar que gracias a su geografía accidentada tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, desde su centro parroquial se puede admirar la ciudad de Cuenca. Su gente tiene un corazón cálido, son amables y trabajan en diferentes actividades que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares.

La Señora María trabaja de lunes a viernes como empleada domestica, esta actividad la realiza sin horario ya que todo depende del tiempo que le tome arreglar las casas en donde trabaja, en su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes, cerdos y ganado, también se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es solo para el consumo de su hogar. Hace un mes ha iniciado el negocio de venta de chuzos (carne en palitos). 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado. 

Su meta es crecer en el negocio de venta de chuzos.
texts.en:
María is taking out her second loan with "10 de Agosto" communal bank. She lives in the Santa Ana parish of Cuenca; a place which thanks to its geographic location has many places where you can enjoy nature. From the parish centre, you can admire the city of Cuenca. It's people are warm-hearted, friendly and work in different activities which allow them to pay their household costs.

María works as a domestic maid from Monday- Friday. She doesn't have fixed hours as it depends on how long it takes her to clean the houses where she works. In her home she looks after guinea-pigs, pigs and cattle. She also grows crops which provide food for her house. A month ago she started a business selling 'chuzos' (meat on sticks). 

She is going to invest the loan in buying cattle.

Her aim is to build up her 'chuzos' business.

loans.use: to buy stock

loans.name: María Laura

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal 10 de Agosto desde hace algunos años. Vive por la parroquia de Santa Ana en Cuenca, lugar que gracias a su geografía accidentada tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, desde su centro parroquial se puede admirar la ciudad de Cuenca. Su gente tiene un corazón cálido, son amables y trabajan en diferentes actividades que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares.

Doña María tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos que ya son mayores de edad, tres de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja para solventar sus gastos personales. Su esposo presta sus servicios como guardia de seguridad, la casa en la que vive es propia

Doña María pasa en casa dedicada los quehaceres de su hogar, pero trabaja duro en el campo en la crianza de animales, en especial de ganado del vende la leche, esta actividad la realiza desde muy pequeña ya que aprendió el oficio de sus padres quien le dejaron como herencia este trabajo, este trabajo le permitió ayudar a sacar en adelante a toda su familia. 

Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de una vaca de la cual ha obtenido buenas ganancias en la venta de la leche. Su  nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de dos vacas de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
María has been a member of "10 de Agosto" communal bank for many years. She lives in the Santa Ana parish of Cuenca; a place which thanks to its geographic location has many places where you can enjoy nature. From the parish centre, you can admire the city of Cuenca. Its people are warm-hearted, friendly and work in different activities which allow them to pay their household costs.

María is 58 years old, married and has 4 children who are all grown up. Three of them are married and live away from home. Her single son works to pay for his personal costs. Her husband is a security guard. They own their own home. 

When María is at home, she does the housework but she also works hard looking after her animals in the field, especially her cattle that produce milk. She has been doing this since she was small. She learnt this trade from her parents who left her this work as an inheritance. This work has enabled her to get her family ahead.  

She invested her last loan in buying a cow from which she has got good profits, in milk sales. She is going to invest her new loan in buying two better quality cows.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Felicitas, ella pertenece al banco “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú. 

La socia sigue con su negocio de elaboracion de muebles como estantes,camas,armarios,comodas entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia cuenta con su taller de carpinteria donde elabora sus muebles,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de materiales como madera para su negocio.

La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar con su actividad económica la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Felicitas belongs to “Los Lideres” (The Leaders) communal bank in the city of Cusco - Peru. 

The member is continuing with her furniture making business making shelves, beds, wardrobes, cupboards etc.
She has had this business for several years and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts in every day. She relies on her carpentry workshop where she makes the furniture. She hopes to be able to continue working in order to keep supporting her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy materials such as wood for her business.

She is very grateful to KIVA for allowing her to be able to continue earning money as it is the main economic income and support for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as wood, for her business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Elena, ella pertenece al banco “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.  

La socia sigue trabajando en una institucion educativa en la ciudad de Cusco,la socia lleva años en este trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su trabajo,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma continua apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para pagar los estudios de sus hijos.

La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar pagando la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elena belongs to “Los Lideres” (The Leaders) communal bank in Cusco - Peru.  

She is still working in a school in the city of Cusco. She has worked there for several years and it is gong well thanks to her daily efforts. She hopes to continue working there so she can keep supporting her family.  

She is requesting this loan to pay for her children's studies.

She is very grateful to KIVA for allowing her to be able to keep paying for her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for her children's schooling

loans.name: Las Productoras  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Las Productoras es un banco comunal formado por 8 mujeres que viven por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es muy visitada por su arquitectura colonial, por su comida típica y su cultura. Las socias son mujeres trabajadoras que luchan día a día en sus trabajos para mejorar su estabilidad económica y sacar adelante a sus hogares. Aun mantienen la cultura, tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Deisi, se encuentra realizando su tercer crédito en el banco comunal Las Productoras,  le gusta el banco comunal por la unión y compañerismo del grupo y también porque con cada crédito mejora su negocio.

La Señora Deisi tiene 26 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 2 años y medio. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico automotriz y labora en un taller que es de su propiedad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Daisi pasa todo el tiempo en casa al cuidado de su hijo que aun está muy pequeño, pero para ayudarle a su esposo a solventar los gastos del hogar vende productos naturales de Forever, lleva 3 años en esta actividad, tiempo en el que ha logrado tener una selecta clientela, ella vende sus productos en su casa. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos naturales para así continuar creciendo en este negocio.

Su sueño es viajar por varios países del mundo.
texts.en:
Las Productoras is a communal bank comprised of eight women who live in the area surrounding the city of Cuenca.  The city is very popular because of its colonial architecture, its typical food, and its culture.  The members are hard-working women who struggle in their work day to day in order to improve their financial stability and to get their households ahead.  They still maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

Deisi is one of the members of this group.  This is her third loan with the Las Productoras communal bank.  She likes the communal bank for the unity and fellowship of the group.  She also likes it because her business improves with each loan.

Deisi, age 26, is married, and they have a two and a half year old child.  Her husband is an auto mechanic, and he works in his own shop.  They do not have their own house, so they are renting where they live.

Deisi spends all of her time at home taking care of her child, who is still very small.  However, in order to help her husband cover the household expenses, she sells Forever natural products.  She has been doing this business activity for three years.  During this time she has managed to get a select clientele.  She sells her products at her house.

She will use her new loan to buy natural products in order for her business to continue growing.

Her dream is to travel to different countries around the world.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Mayra Aracely

texts.es:
La Clienta Mayra vive en Manta, tiene 28 años de edad. Ella nos cuenta que siempre  quiso ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, y fue entonces que empezó a vender ropa y cosméticos a sus amistades.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, trabaja todos los dias, ella visita a sus amigas y les ofrece la mercadería. En su negocio se le han presentado dificultad con su salud y con los ladrones del barrio.

Ella está casada, y tiene 2 pequeños hijos uno de 2 y otro de 6 años de edad. Con el préstamo va a comprar mercadería como: blusas, camisas, licras, cosméticos. Etc. Para haci tener mas ingresos económicos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mayra lives in Manta and is 28 years old. She says that she always wanted to help her husband with household expenses, and that was why she began to sell clothing and cosmetics to her friends.

She sells clothing and cosmetics, working every day. She visits her friends and offers them merchandise. Problems have arisen in her business with regard to her health and with thieves in the neighborhood.

She is married and has two small children, ages 6 and 2. With the loan, she is going to buy merchandise such as blouses, shirts, spandex, cosmetics, etc., so that she can have more income in her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as: plazas, shirts, pants, spandex, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Mukhtaran

texts.en:
Ms. Mukhtaran is a 54-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house for two years. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts for years. 

Mukhtaran wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Ms. Shahnaz is a 28-year-old married woman who is living with her husband and four children in Punjab, Pakistan. For many years she has been in the work of hand-embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.
 
To help her to continue her operations, Shahnaz has requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy reels of thread in different colors, with packs of sequins, beads and stones for embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. 

Shahnaz dreams of her children's bright future and desires to build her own house, as she is living in a rented house with her family. She is very much thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors, with packs of sequins, beads and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Ms. Sajida is a 23-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason, Sajida requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will create a means of increasing revenues, so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Ms Rukhsana is a 30-year-old married woman; she has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 1.5 years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts for years.

She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand of her customers. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of providing better standard of living to her children.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.name: Azizan

texts.en:
Ms Azizan is a 49-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last five years. She offers various items and goods for everyday use. She has good communication skills and has a good client list. Her husband also helps her in her business as he is a laborer and earns insufficient income to support his family alone.

She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to buy stocks of detergents and other grocery items in large quantities to meet the increasing demand at her store. She wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her children's education and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of detergents and other grocery items in bulk to meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Ms Irshad is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last ten years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. 

Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide for her family. 

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her fourth loan and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Ms Jamila is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. For the past 20 years, Jamila has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a cow to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. Now she has one buffalo and two cows. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of 20,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Ms. Sumaira has expertise in hand-embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over six years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. 

During the initial years of her business, Sumaira barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today, she is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. 

Three years ago, Sumaira borrowed from Kashf for the first time to purchase embroidery material. Currently, she requested a loan worth Rs. 20,000 to purchase more spools of thread with packs of sequins and pearls in different colors. She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time, and satisfying them is a challenge that Sumaira has taken up.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread with packs of sequins and pearls in different colors.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Ms Abida is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She has been efficiently doing a business of animal sales for many years. She purchases small goats and sheep and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries like Pakistan). 

Now she has three goats and two sheep and earns a good profit from this business. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

She has some savings and has applied for a loan of 15,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to purchase two more small goats. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase two more small goats.

loans.name: Llapallanchis Purisunchis Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LLAPALLANCHIS PURISUNCHIS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Eveling ella es soltera y tiene 23 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de   restauración de obras de arte, la socia restaura obras como cuadros y pinturas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda arreglar los cuadros y pinturas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar materiales para que arregle los cuadros y pinturas como pegamentos, aquarelas y pinceles.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de materiales de construcción, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the “LLAPALLANCHIS PURISUNCHIS” communal bank, located in the Cusco district, part of the Cusco province and department.

Eveling is single and 23 years old.  She restores works of art such as framed art and paintings and works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.  She’s been doing this for eight years and things are going well for her.  Her dream is to have shop where she can repair pictures and paintings.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies such as glues, watercolors, and brushes.

The other members sell things such as building materials, food, groceries or run restaurants.

She’s grateful to those who form part of this dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy construction materials (blocks, iron, cement, sand, stone and others) to build a wall around her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en: Ms Nasira is 24-year-old lady with expertise in hand embroidery. She has been using her skill to provide for her family for many years. Today she is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. Five years ago, when she borrowed from Kashf for the first time, she wished to purchase embroidery material. Currently, she requested another loan of  Rs 45,000 to purchase more spools of threads with packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material in various colors. She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Nasira has taken up.

loans.use: to purchase more threads, sequins, pearls and glittering material in various colors.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 4 filhos, 2 Já estão no lar e outros ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta uma sobrinha que vive com ela.
É agente de serviço no Ministério de Saúde e com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (arame, ferro, cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para continuar com a remodelação da sua casa.
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e continuar a apostar nos estudos dos seus filhos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é continuar a investir nos estudos dos filhos ate a licenciatura.
texts.en:
Victoria is married and the mother of 4 children, 2 are at home and the others go to School. She lives in her own house and supports a niece who lives with her.

She works for the Ministry of Health and with this loan she plans to buy construction materials (wire, iron, cement, sand, stone and others) to continue the remodelling of her home.

In future she hopes to finish the building work and continue to finance her children's studies. She commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to continue to invest in her children's studies until they get degrees.

loans.use: buy construction materials (wire, iron, cement, sand, stone and others) to continue the remodelling of her home.

loans.name: Hang's Group

texts.en:
Hang was born in 1989. She has a little child. Her husband is a carpenter, and his income is 7,000,000 VND per month. Hang is a worker to earn a living. She earns 4,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 11,000,000 VND per month. 

Hang has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2013. In this first loan, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy groceries to open a small grocery store.

Other members who are part of Hang's group include the following: 

Tuyen was born in 1967. She has two children. She is a grocery seller. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy noodles, rice and biscuits to sell. 

Huong was born in 1987. She has two children. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy wood to do carpentry. 	

Nhuong was born in 1983. She has three children. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy wood to do carpentry. 

Mo was born in 1991. She has a child. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy wood to do carpentry. 

Hang was born in 1989. She has a child. She is a nurse. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to open a small grocery store in her house. 

Khanh was born in 1986. She has two children. She is a worker to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy wood to do carpentry.

loans.use: to buy groceries to open a small grocery store.

loans.name: Lester Mirecthy Gabriela

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Junín se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque se destila el mejor aguardiente en la provincia y en el Ecuador.

En este lugar vive la señora Lester, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es agricultor y ganadero.

Doña Lester es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sus propios medios sin tener que depender de nadie, ella hace más de 16 años y  con los ahorros que tenia instaló en su casa una pequeña boutique la misma que con el paso del tiempo le ha ido aumentando y surtiendo, allí vende ropa, zapatos, bisutería y muchos artículos mas tanto de caballeros,  damas y niños. Hace poco compro una copiadora con la cual también le queda un ingreso extra a más de lo que ya le quedaba con la boutique. 

Este crédito es para comprar zapatos exclusivamente. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio ya que le encanta lo que hace.
texts.en:
The Junín Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Junín. This place is known for its friendly people. The best brandy in the province and all of Ecuador is distilled here.

Sra. Lester lives in this place. She is 56 years old, married, and has three grown children who are independent. Her husband is a farmer and rancher.

Doña Lester is a woman who likes to support herself through her own means without having to depend on anyone. She has done this for more than 16 years and used her savings to open a small boutique in her house. Over time, her business has increased and gained more inventory. There she sells clothing, shoes, trinkets, and many other items for men, women, and children. Some time ago, she purchased a copying machine as a way of earning some extra income on top of what is generated from her boutique.

This loan will be used exclusively to buy shoes. Sra. Lester has been with the Communal Bank for four loan cycles and enjoys the easy payment options. Her dream is to move forward with her business since she enjoys what she does.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Fiza

texts.en: Ms Fiza is a 33-year-old lady who enjoys doing hand embroidery work. She started doing work to support her family as her husband is doing labor and his income is not enough to run the household alone. Fiza’s embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory and she earns enough to contribute to the family's income. Due to the increasing demand for her embroidery designs, she is hiring other women in her business. She has three children and is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. In order to meet the growing demand for embroidery, she needs to hire some more women, so she requested a loan of Rs 15,000 from Kashf Foundation. In this way, she can manage to buy more frames, beads,sequins and spools of threads in various colors, which will help in generating more income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, beads, sequins and spools of threads

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Ms. Robina is a 26-year-old married woman; she is successfully running a business of a general store. She is eager to support her family members financially and to provide a better future to her children. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.  

In order to make her store fully stocked, Robina needs to purchase a stock of rice and flour with packs of pulses and grains. For this reason, she applied to Kashf foundation for a loan of Rs. 20,000. 

Robina wishes to spend part of the income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of rice and flour with packs of pulses and grains.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 8 filhos, dos quais 4 ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta uma sobrinha que vive com ela.
É comerciante e dona do seu próprio negócio de venda de produtos alimentares diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (farinha, bebidas, sabão, óleo, frangos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de mercadoria do seu estabelecimento.
