He believes that education is one of the keys to success in their lives and that it can break the poverty cycle.
You is now requesting a loan in order to buy a cow for the maintenance of his paddy fields. To do so, he can reduce the operational costs that he used to pay for animal hire fees in each harvest season. This loan will help him focus more on his crops. You's dream is to extend his farmland so as to better his profit.

loans.use: to buy a cow for the maintenance of his paddy fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Pao

texts.en: Pao is 32 years old and lives with his long-term partner in Kompong Speu province. Together, they have one child who will be enrolled in school soon. Pao is in the business of farming rice just for an income, which hardly seems to fulfill his family's daily necessities. Additionally, he works to provide construction services with his team around the province. Due to the lack of a motorcycle for daily travelling and commuting, Pao decided to borrow a loan through HKL, one of Kiva partners, to purchase a motorbike for personal use. Also, he will utilize the rest of the fund to pay for laborers who are constructing his house. Last time, Pao just owned a palm house that was not comfortable for his family. Pao thanks the lenders that enable him to continuously develop his living standard. His dream is to work a lot for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for personal use

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan has been a farmer, growing rice and vegetables for almost 10 years, and it has been her primary source of income for the family. She is married to a farmer and she has become a good mother of two children. Chan and her husband have a good cooperation, and at the moment they are quite busy with their vegetable farm where they work to provide good nutrition for their vegetables. Chan is very ambitious for her business and she dreams of having a bigger land size to cultivate more crops, so as to improve her standard of living.

Chan has been with HKL for a loan already and she successfully used her previous loan to improve her income. This will be her second loan cycle, which she will utilize to buy a farm animal to keep growing her current business. She hopes this loan will be a wise investment for her and that she can continue to upgrade her living status.

loans.use: to buy a farm animal to keep growing her current business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 56, has a large family of eleven children; his oldest is 32 years and a local businessman in his local area.
In recent years, David has been working in poultry farming/business. He buys chicks and rears them until they are old enough for commercial consumption. He is now seeking a loan from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for the same cause. He is planning to buy more poultry chicks for rearing.
For a long time David has been able to survive on the savings he got from his poultry business, and also he has been able to educate his children through this project. His main challenges are chicken diseases and the high costs of feeds, yet consumers are not willing to pay an increased price.
David thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for the financial services they have given, especially to low income earners like him.

loans.use: To buy chicks that he will rear and later sell

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry was born in 1970 in Masya–Rukungiri District and is married with nine children.

He has been an agriculturalist since 1984. He carried out farming for quite a long time and later started a small bar/restaurant which he has depended on for income to educate his children and meet his family's needs.

He decided to join UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for financial assistance in order to promote and increase his cattle fattening business. With this loan, Henry is going to buy more cows for rearing.  He sells the cows after some time of feeding to the required commercial market for consumption.  He is also planning to expand his bar/restaurant business by using the business capital obtained from the cattle business.

Henry admits that he is very glad for the services rendered by UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) in the form of loans because they have helped him so much to expand and diversify his business.

loans.use: To buy cattle for rearing

loans.name: Betty Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Betty vive en Libertad, ella tiene 35 años de edad.
Ella comenzó vendiendo con su tía poca mercadería, en su vecindario, a sus amistades, a su familia pero poco a poco se fue independizándose hasta que  ella empezó a vender ya sola.
Ella vende la ropa todos los días de 9:30 de la mañana hasta las 11:00 del día y ahí se da un tiempo para volver a salir a las 16:000 hasta las 18:30 de la tarde. 
No tiene ninguna dificultad en su labor.
Ella  si tiene esposo y trabaja de albañil, y tienen 3 hijos de 13, 10 y 14 años edad.

Con el préstamo ella va a comprar mercadería para su negocio como: camisetas, pantalones, blusas. etc.
Ella desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Betty is 35 years old and lives in Libertad.

She began selling a little merchandise with her aunt— in her neighborhood to her friends and family, but little by little became independent, until she began to sell on her own. She sells clothing every day from 9:30am until 11:00am, so there is time for her to go out again at 4:00pm until 6:30pm. 

She has no problems in her work. She has a husband who works in construction, and they have three children, ages 14, 13, and 10.

With the loan she is going to buy merchandise for her business, such as T-shirts, pants, blouses, etc. She wishes to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business: T-shirts, shirts and pants.

loans.name: Tupendane C Group

texts.en:
Twaha, who is in his early 40s, is married with three children. Two of them are grown up and the last one is still going to school. Twaha has been a tailor for fifteen years now. He works from 8.00 am to 10.pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Twaha's 21st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more sewing machines. Twaha started with one sewing machine but now he has four sewing machines, plus employees. He used to sew Mosquito nets but now he makes good dress suits for men and can print labels on T-shirts. He used his profit to buy a plot of land and has started building his house. He also used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses. Twaha has paid back all his loans successfully. He will use this loan to buy a zig-zag machine for making designs on clothes. He dreams of finishing building his house, renovating his working place by enlarging it, and painting the shop to make it more attractive.

Twaha will share this loan with his loan group "Tupendane C" which has a total of 11 members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a zig-zag machine for making designs on clothes.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Ms Sonia is a 22-year-old married lady, and she has been providing the service of cooking from her home for many years. She supplies to the nearby hotels and people of her community. She enjoys making food and has become famous in her town for providing these facilities. She is earning enough to lead a decent life. In order to meet the orders on time Sonia needs to purchase important ingredients in large quantities. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs.30, 000/- from Kashf Foundation. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase stocks of rice, grains and salt with packs of oil. Sonia wishes to utilize her earned profit on her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice, grains and salt with packs of oil.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Ms Zahida has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for many years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today she is proud to be famous in her community to be the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she has requested a loan of Rs.35, 000/- to purchase more spools of threads with packs of sequins, pearls and stones for embellishment. She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Zahida has taken up.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads with packs of sequins, pearls and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Jeanine Del Rosario

texts.es:
Doña Jeanine de 59 años de edad, originaria de Matagalpa, actualmente vive en Managua, soltera, madre de 1 hijo, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de nacatamales del que es propietario hace más de 20 años, ella realizo sus estudios hasta tercer año de secundaria. Inicio su actividad  ayudándole a su mama, fue allí que adquirió experiencia y total dominio del negocio, luego con el tiempo al independizarse decide seguir con el mismo negocio, porque le genera muchas ganancias a diario, este ha sido su primer negocio, el cual saca adelante con el apoyo de sus hijo y su mama, sus productos los comercializa en los barrios cercanos en donde vive.
Ella está necesitando el financiamiento para comprar leña, carne , tomates, papas, hojas de plátanos y un barril para almacenar los nacatamales. Toda la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración y darle el sabor a sus nacatamales, ya que el préstamo le será de mucha ayuda pues podrá invertir más en su inventario, incrementando su producción, de esta manera obtener mejores ingresos para la familia, una de sus metas es diversificar su negocio en otros lugares, pues su deseo es llegar a ser una de las mejores comerciante de la zona.
texts.en:
Jeanine, 59, is from Matagalpa, and currently lives in Managua. She is the single mother of one son and she works as a merchant who makes and sells nacatamales [banana leaf wrapped meat and rice dish]. 

She has owned her business for over twenty years. She completed her studies up to her junior year in high school. 

She started her work by helping her mother. It was there that she gained experience and a full understanding of the business. Once she came of age she decided to keep going in the same line of work because it generated a lot of profit on a daily basis. 

This has been her first business which she runs with her son and mom. She sells her product in the nearby neighborhoods where she lives. 

She is requesting the loan to buy firewood, meat, tomatoes, potatoes, banana leaves and a barrel to store the nacatamales. 
All of the ingredients she needs for cooking and to give the nacatamales taste.

The loan will help her a lot since she will be able to invest more in her inventory increasing her production. 

In this way she will obtain the best income for her family. One of her goals is to diversify her business to other areas as her wish is to become one of the best merchants in the area.

loans.use: to buy firewood, meat, tomatoes, potatoes, banana leaves and a barrel.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Джамила трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Ей 29 лет. Она разведена и воспитывает своего ребенка одна. Она живет вместе с родителями и сестрой. Джамила планирует организовать свой бизнес и таким образом стать независимой и обеспечить своего ребенка со всеми не обходимыми средствами. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культур, как помидор, картошка, корм и гранаты, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ для покупки семена и минерального удобрения, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Jamila is a hardworking and kind woman.  She is 29 years old.  She is divorced and is raising her child alone.  She lives with her parents and sisters.  Jamila plans to start her own business and become independent and provide her child with all necessary resources.  With this goal she took the course "Get Ahead" organized by the National Association of Business Women of Tajikistan and earned a certificate.  Now she will be able to start her business and become successful.  She would like to start a farming business and grow produce such as tomatoes, potatoes, feed and pomegranates, as she has experience in this type of business.  She plans to use the profits to improve her living conditions.  She is asking for a loan to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers in order to start her new business.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers to start a new business

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро жительница города Вахдат, расположенного в юго-западной части Таджикистана. Ей 51 год. Она замужем и имеет троих дочерей. Вместе с ними еще проживает ее одна племянница, которая учится у Зухро вышиванию. Зухро более 6 лет как работает швеёй. Она вышывает национальные женские платья и принимает заказы у себя дома. В месяц Зухро вышывает более 50 платьев. Ей помогают также ее ученицы. Сейчас Зухро обратилась за кредитом. На полученный кредит она намеревается приобрести компьютерную швейную машину, а оставшуюся часть использовать на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Zuhro is a resident of the city of Vahdat located in the southwest part of Tajikistan.  She is 51 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Her niece also lives with them and is learning how to embroider from Zuhro.  Zuhro has been working as a seamstress for more than 6 years.  She embroiders traditional women's dresses and takes orders from her home.  Zuhro embroiders more than 50 dresses per month.  Her students help her.  Right now Zuhro applied for a loan.  She plans to use the loan to buy a computerized sewing machine and to use the remainder to make home repairs.

loans.use: make home repairs

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband in a portion of her house. She has gained fifteen years of experience in this field. Her son also assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts for years. She is a mother of eight children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
La joven Gloria es una persona emprendedora,  honesta  y seria, vive con su esposo y sus  5 hijos  en una comunidad al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  venta  de tortillas. 
Gloria el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  maíz, lena y cal.  Con el préstamo  espera que las ventas en su negocio  mejoren al tener más mercancía que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos y con esto mejorar la situación  económica. 
Gloria espera que  a un corto plazo su negocio siga creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande,  rentable y  reconocido de su caserío. Y seguir  apoyando a sus hijos y se conviertan en personas honesta con principios y valores.




Choluteca, Honduras –  Febrero  del   2013
texts.en: Gloria is an enterprising, honest, and serious young person.  She lives with her husband and five children in a community in southern Honduras.  She has a business selling tortillas.  Gloria needs this loan to buy corn, firewood, and lime.  With this loan, she hopes that her sales will improve by having more merchandise to offer her customers and to cover their needs.  With this, her economic situation will improve.  Gloria hopes that in the short term, her business will keep growing and getting established so she can make it bigger, more profitable, and better-known in her town.  She wants to keep supporting her children and to see them become honest people with principles and values.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Jura

texts.ru: Жура 73 года. Он женат и у него двое детей. Он со своей семьей проживает в районе Шахритус в юго-западной части Таджикистана. Его жена рабоатет в дехканском хозяйстве. Дехканское хозяйство это небольшое индивидуальное или коллективное частное хозяйство, в котором работают несколько людей и где в основном выращивают хлопок, пшеницу или овощи - которые занимают 60% орошаемых земель в Таджикистане. Сам Жура занимается земледелием. Он в этой сфере более 18 лет и имеет уже большой опыт. Сейчас Жура запрашивает кредит для приобретения семян арбуза и карболита. За счет прибыли с урожая Жура планирует приобрести еще 1га орошаемой земли и тем самым расширить свою земледельческую деятельность.
texts.en: Jura is 73 years old, married and has 2 children.  He and his family lives in the Shahrituz region in the southwest of Tajikistan.  His wife works on a farm.  Farms are comprised of a small, individual effort, or are part of a collective where several people work growing cotton, wheat or vegetables--this accounts for 60% of irrigated land in Tajikistan.  Jura also works in agriculture and has for 18 years.  Now he is asking for a loan to buy watermelon seeds and plastic.  With the profits from the harvest, Jura plans to buy an additional hectare of irrigated land to expand his farming activities.

loans.use: to buy watermelon seeds and plastic

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a peasant from Rukanga Cell, Ntungamo District, married to Kemirembe (pictured with him). Richard deals in the produce and coffee business. However he has planted a banana plantation to which he needs to apply manure to boost the plantation. This will increase family income instead of relying on coffee alone, which is seasonal. He looks forward to finances from UgafodeMl.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Mohbana

texts.ru: Мохбана замужняя женщина. Ей 59 лет. У нее есть взрослый сын и дочь. Ее сын женатый молодой человек, работает в магазине рядом с домом. А дочь уже окончила школу. Мохбана со своей семьей проживает в городе Вахдат в юго-западной части Таджикистана. Ее муж в данное время находится на заработках в загранице. Сама Мохбана в течение 5 лет работает швеёй. Она вышивает национальные женские платья. Сейчас Мохбана запрашивает кредит для приобретения новой швейной машины.
texts.en: Mohbana is 59 years old, married, and has a grown daughter and son.  Her son is young and married, and works at a store near their home.  Her daughter has already finished high school.  Mohbana lives with her family in the city of Vahdat in the southwest of Tajikistan.  At the moment, her husband is a migrant worker in another country.  Mohbana herself has worked as a seamstress for 5 years.  She embroiders the national women's dress.  Now, she is asking for a loan to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Marjona

texts.ru: Марчона молодая замужняя женщина. Ей 21 год. Она проживает в городе Вахдат в юго-западной части Таджикистана. Муж Марчоны в данное время находится на заработках за пределами страны. Марчона имеет среднее техническое образование и она работает учительницей в школе. Одновременно Марчона уже год как работает швеёй. Она вышивает национальные женские платья. Сейчас Марчона обратилась за кредитом. Она просит кредит для приобретения швейной машины.
texts.en: Marjona is 21 and married.  She lives in the city Vahdat in the southwest of Tajikistan.  Her husband is currently a migrant worker in another country. She has a secondary, technical education and she works as a teacher in a school.  At the same time, she has worked as a seamstress for the last year.  She embroiders the national women's dress.  Now, Marjona is asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Venis

texts.en: Venis is a 37-year-old woman. She has been doing business in the cloth trade for the last two years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. She makes enough through her business to provide for her family. Venis requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy stocks of different cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of different cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy daily household use items to sell

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru:
Заррина хранительница здоровья людей. Она работает старшей медсестрой в больнице и помогает больным с восстановлением здоровья. Она добрый медик, так как поддерживает и вылечивает больных не только лекарствами, но и своими словами. Всегда приходит на помощь всем своим соседям, друзьям и близком. Но так сложилось, что несколько лет тому назад  муж с ней развелся. Зарина осталась одна с двумя маленькими детьми. Собрав все силы в кулак, смогла смириться и идти вперёд по жизни. Как любящая мама всегда заботится о детях и трудится, чтобы жить в достатке и не нуждаться.
 Как любая женщина, Зарина хочет иметь красивые вещи, украшения. Но её доход не позволяет тратиться на дополнительные вещи, кроме необходимых. Узнав об кредитовании решила воспользоваться и купить ювелирное изделие к праздникам. Надеется, что  МДО «Арванд»  поможет ей осуществить простую женскую мечту   трудолюбивой женщины.
texts.en:
Zarina is a health professional.  She works as a senior nurse in a hospital and helps sick people recover their health.  She is a kind professional who supports and treats her patients not only with medications, but with her words of encouragement.  She also always helps all her neighbors, friends and relatives.  

However, a few years ago, Zarina's husband asked for a divorce, and she was left alone with two young children.  Gathering her strength, she learned to accept her situation and decided to move forward.  As a loving mother who always worries about her children, she works hard so that her family has enough and does not lack anything.

Like any woman, Zarina would like to own some nice things, such as jewelry.  However, her income does not allow her to spend any money on things other than the basic necessities.  Having learned about the possibility of credit, she decided to use this opportunity to buy some jewelry before the holidays.  She hopes that MDO Arvand will help to make the dream of a simple and hardworking woman come true.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Bibisho

texts.ru: Бибишо добрый и мудрый старик своего района. Он любимый муж, отец и дедушка. Бибишо живет в горном Таджикистане и гордится своей Родиной. Он с удовольствием занимается земледелием более 7 лет. Он выращивает хлопок, пшеницу и другие зерновые культуры. Он знает все тонкости земледелия и поэтому продает свои продукции по хорошей цене. Однако, не смотря на все его усилия он не может уже в течении многих лет улучшить условию проживания, например купить компьютер внукам, купить кондиционер жене, которая страдает от жары летом. Он имеет большой план в этом году, а для реализации всех планов он должен получить больше урожая. С такой целью он обратился за займом, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения для земли и семена для посева. Он ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет Бибишо и его семье улучшить условию проживания.
texts.en:
Bibisho is a kind and wise old man from Tajikistan.  He is a loving husband, father and grandfather.  He lives in the mountainous part of his country and is very proud of his homeland.  He has enjoyed farming for more than seven years, growing cotton, wheat and other grains.  He knows all the subtleties of agriculture, which allows him to sell his crop production at a good price.  

However, in spite of his best efforts, Bibisho has not been able to improve his living conditions for many years.  For example, he has not been able to buy a computer for his grandchildren or an air conditioning unit for his wife, who suffers from the heat in the summer.

Bibisho has a large project, which he would like to realize this year, but for the realization of all his plans, he needs to get a bigger harvest.  This is the reason why he is applying for a loan, which will help him to buy mineral fertilizers for his land, as well as seeds to sow.  

Bibisho is relying on your kindness.  This loan will help Bibisho and his family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rifat

texts.en: Ms Rifat is a 33-year-old married woman with a milk-selling business, which she has operated for the past 20 years with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Rifat's husband. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She is a loving mother of four children, one daughter and three sons. She is trying hard to fulfill their needs, including food, health, clothing, and education. She has improved her business to meet the day to day expenses of life.  She has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase one cow to get an increase in milk production which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one cow to get an increase in milk production

loans.name: Zubida

texts.en: Ms Zubida is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband and to support her family for a better future. Eight years ago, she began sewing shoes. She receives orders from the shoe factory and earns income to support her entire family. However, due to her lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers.  For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 from Kashf. She intends to use this loan to buy spools of thread, packs of buttons and leather material to create a means of increasing her revenue and generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads, packs of buttons and leather material.

loans.name: Aaysha

texts.en: Ms Aaysha is a 56-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business selling dressmaking supplies. She offers various colorful laces, buttons and ribbons to the people of her community and earns enough to lead a decent life. She has gained three years of experience in this field and has attained a regular list of customers. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone.  She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy more threads, laces and ribbons in different colors and designs. Then she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her second loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy more threads, laces and ribbons in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Ms Zareena is a 42-year-old vigorous lady who has been sewing sweaters for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread and wool in various colors to create a means of increasing revenues to generate a healthier source of income. She is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads and wool in various colors.

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en: Ms Sidra is a 21-year-old married woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for three years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through providing her best services, she has become very famous in her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor.  But because of having low cash on hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan. She needs a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy packs of cleansers, makeup kits and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hoping to serve more customers time after time, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy cleansers, makeup kits and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Kishwer

texts.en: Ms Kishwer is a 45-year-old married woman. She has had a beauty parlor business for seven years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through providing her best services, she has become very famous on her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetic products for the parlor.  But because of having low cash on hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her fifth loan. She needs a loan of Rs 50,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hoping to serve more customers time after time. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Ms Nasreen had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. Twelve years ago, she began sewing in her house. She sews for the shoe-making factory around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. She is a mother of four children and motivated to provide them with good quality food, health and education. By now, she has attained a regular list of customers.  However, due to the lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 30,000. This will help her to purchase one more sewing machine and spools of threads in various colors. She is currently in her sixth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase one more sewing machine and threads in various colors.

loans.name: Tupendane Kongowe Group

texts.en:
Omary, who is in his early 40s, is a married man with three children (two boys and a girl) of whom two are in school and the remaining one is still young. Since 2002, Omary has been running a retail business selling foods of different kinds like rice, sugar, salt, maize flour etc. He is doing fine in this field. He works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to earn a fair profit per month. 

This will be his third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which he repaid back successfully, he managed to restock more items in his business and opened another food shop. With the profit earned, he covered home expenses as well as school fees. He will use this loan to increase his food items to meet the increased client demand. He dreams of building a house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Tupendane Kongowe" which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his food items to meet the increased client demand.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 45-year-old married woman and a loving mother of seven children, two daughters and five sons. She enjoys her business of tailoring and earns a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. Shamim has in-depth knowledge of high quality tailoring and her son also helps in her work. She earns enough for a hand-to-mouth existence. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy one more sewing machine with more spools of threads to meet the customers’ orders on time. She expects a boost in her net income and wishes to spend part of the income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more sewing machine with more spools of threads to meet the customers’ orders on time.

loans.name: Naseen

texts.en: Naseen is a 57-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband in a corner of her house. She has gained six years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts for years. She is the mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 10,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and oil to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and oil to meet with the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Rashda

texts.en: Rashda is a 47-year-old vigorous lady and the mother of two children, one who is school going. She has been stitching clothes for the past 20 years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of lace, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Yamileth Jannette

texts.es:
Yamileth, 45 años de edad, originaria de Managua, casada, madre de 2 hijos de 18 y 20 años, actualmente solo uno estudia y el otro trabaja, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de gaseosa de la que es propietaria hace más de 8 años. Inicio en la actividad laboral desde muy joven con su mama, en el negocio de venta de tortillas y una pulpería, fue allí que adquirió experiencia y total dominio del negocio, luego al casarse, ella decidió  seguir con el mismo negocio ya que le generaba muchas ganancias porque quedaba cerca un colegio y sus ventas eran cada día mayor, también vende ropa para obtener otros ingresos extras, cuenta el apoyo de su hijo.
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar sardinas enlatadas, galletas, gaseosa, jugos,pan , huevo etc. Con el objetivo de comprar más productos que aún no tiene en inventario, ya se acerca la temporada de verano y es cuando la demanda de sus productos crecen, una de sus metas próximas es seguir luchando cada día para mantener estable su negocio.
texts.en:
Yamileth is 45 years old and originally from Managua.  She is married and mother to two children, aged 18 and 20 years old.  Currently one of her children is studying and the other works.  Yamileth makes a living selling fizzy drinks and has had her business for over eight years.  She started this work when she was very young, working in her mother's grocery store, where they also sold tortillas.  It was there that Yamileth gained experience and learned how to run the business.  Later, when she married, Yamileth decided to continue with this same business which generated so much profit as she was near a school and her profits were growing daily.  Yamileth also sells clothes to make extra income, and she receives support from her son.

Yamileth is applying for a loan to buy tinned sardines, biscuits, fizzy drinks, juices, bread, eggs and more.  Her objective is to buy more products that she does not yet have in stock as the summer is coming and it is then that demand increases.  One of Yamileth's next goals is to continue fighting to keep her business stable.

loans.use: to buy tinned sardines, biscuits, fizzy drinks, juices, bread eggs and more.

loans.name: Maria Nubia

texts.es:
Maria de 51 años de edad, originaria de San Rafael del Sur, pero actualmente vive en Managua, casada, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de piñatas de la que es propietaria hace más de 31 años. Primeramente inicio vendiendo tortillas con su mama, pero con el tiempo miraron que este negocio no le generaba muchas ganancias, fue allí que decidió emprender su propio negocio de la venta de piñatas, el cual si le genera ingresos, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su marido y el de su mama quien le ayuda a administrar su negocio, cuenta con otros ingresos como es el dinero que le genera su moto taxi.
 Sus expectativas es hacer crecer su negocio para obtener mejores ingresos. Ella esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar papel periódico, pega, almidón, hoyas de barro,alambre etc. Ya que ella estima que este crédito le será de gran ayuda porque le permitirán comprar toda la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de sus piñatas, de esta manera cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, una de sus metas próximas es poder dar empleos a personas que lo necesiten y establecer un taller de manualidades.
texts.en:
María is 51 years old and originally from San Rafael del Sur.  Now, though, she lives in Managua.  She is married and has a business where she makes and sells piñatas.  She has had the business for over 31 years.  She began a business selling tortillas with her mother but, as time went by, they realised that this did not generate much profit and so María started her business selling piñatas.  From this she does make a profit.  María has the support of her husband and of her mother, who helps her to manage the business.  María also has income coming in from what she makes with her motorbike taxi.

María expects to expand her business to makes a better income.  She is applying for a loan to buy newspapers, glue, paste, clay pots, wire and more.  María thinks that this loan will be a great help to her as it will allow her to buy all the materials she needs to make her piñatas.  With this she will be able able to fill all the orders her customers give her.  One of María's goals is to be able to give work to others who need it and to create a handicrafts workshop.

loans.use: to buy newspaper, glue, paste and clay pots.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La  Señora Rosa es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es venta  de  cosméticos  y maíz. 
Doña Rosa el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de maíz. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
Doña Rosa espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de  los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona.
Doña Rosa espera seguir trabajando para darles a sus hijos los estudios y que estos se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida. 	




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Febrero  del   2013
texts.en:
Rosa is a responsible, hard-working, and honest person. She lives with her husband and her three children in the south of the Honduras. Her business is selling cosmetics and maize.

Rosa needs the loan in order to buy maize. With the loan she hopes that sales in her business will increase by having more products on offer and by attending to her customers better.

Rosa hopes to meet all the needs she has and improve her quality of life a little, as well as that of her family. In a few years she hopes that her business will continue to grow and become one of the biggest and most recognized businesses in the area.

Rosa hopes to continue working to give her children an education so that they will become respectable people with better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy maize for her business

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario served in the Air Force from 1984 to 1988 and made his career in law enforcement. He was a deputy sheriff, municipal police officer, and federal agent. 

Mario lost his job during the recession, financially devastating his family and destroying his credit. Over the following years, he decided to build on his military and law enforcement experience; he trained to become a firearms and security guard instructor. He is certified by California to provide training to others wishing to enter the security field.

Mario decided to establish the National Justice Training Center to help veterans put their military experience to work and become trained security guards. He will also help them find employment as security guards and re-integrate back into the community. In helping them support their families, he'll be supporting his own. The center will train non-veterans and will also provide basic firearms training to the public. Currently, Fresno has only one other security guard training provider.

Mario was unable to obtain a bank loan due to his credit issues. He sought help at the local Small Business Administration office which referred him to Fresno CDFI. He needs this loan to furnish a classroom and buy training equipment and other supplies. Fresno CDFI is strongly encouraged by Mario's tenacity, strong business plan, and mission to help other veterans find jobs.

loans.use: to furnish a classroom and purchase equipment

loans.name: Jerardo Ramon

texts.es:
Don Jerardo un humilde señor de 62 años, originario de Carazo Jinotepe, pero actualmente vive en Managua, casado, padre de 4 hijos, mayores de edad, todos son independiente, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de mercadería variada, su nivel académico es licenciado en Contabilidad pero su deseo de superación lo motivo a emprender su propio negocio.  Inicio su actividad laboral  desde muy joven trabajando en una empresa, prestando los servicios de Contador, pero luego decidió renunciar porque un amigo le enseño cómo funcionaba el negocio de vender mercadería variada como ropa, cosméticos, artículos escolares, él se siente muy satisfecho porque en su negocio le va  bien con las ganancias que le genera cada día, ha podido mejorar la infraestructura de su casa pero necesita surtir más su negocio.
En su negocio recibe el apoyo de su esposa. Hoy en día sus productos los comercializa en su casa de habitación. Él está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar toallas, chinelas, trajes de baño, ropa interior para mujer, etc.  Ya que se acerca la temporada de  verano y semana santa en donde la demanda de esta mercadería aumenta, dentro de sus planes futuros es poder establecer una librería y de esta manera obtener otros ingresos extras.
texts.en:
Jerardo is 62 years old and quite poor.  He is originally from Carazo Jinotepe but currently lives in Managua.  He is married and father to four children, all of whom are now independent adults.  Jerardo makes a living selling various merchandise.  He is a qualified accountant but, given his desire to get ahead in life, he decided to start his own business.  He started working in a business very young, as an accountant, but later quit when a friend taught him how to run a business selling merchandise such as clothes, make-up and items for school.  Jerardo is very satisfied as the business is going well and with the money he is earning every day he has been able to improve his home.  However, he needs to stock up his business.

At work, Jerardo receives support from his wife,  He currently sells his products out of a room in his home.  Jerardo is applying for a loan to buy towels, slippers, bathing suits, women's underwear and more.  With the summer approaching, demand will be higher, just as it is at Easter.  As part of his plans for the future, Jerardo wants to start a bookshop as an extra source of income.

loans.use: to buy towels, slippers, swimsuits, women's underwear and more.

loans.name: Rebekah

texts.en:
"I'm fixing the world one massage at a time,” said Rebekah, certified massage therapist and owner of R and R Therapeutic Massage. “If everyone got even one massage a month, then I truly think that there would be no more anger in the world."

Rebekah worked in preschool education for almost 10 years in Concord, California until 2005 when her program faced dramatic cuts. Later that year, she enrolled in massage therapy school and became a certified massage therapist nine months later. "I was still educating people, just in a different way,” says Rebekah. "People tend to think of massage therapy as a high end luxury, but it truly is needed to feel healthy."

In 2007, Rebekah began working as a certified massage therapist at Massage Envy in Walnut Creek. A few years later, she was awarded Regional Therapist of the Year 2011 after being the most requested therapist for several years. By 2012, she was appointed Lead Massage Therapist in charge of hiring and training new therapists.  She realized that if she wanted to advance her career, she needed to create her own company. In January of 2013, R and R Therapeutic Massage was created.

loans.use: to purchase a hydraulic table, hot stone set, hot towel caddy, waterless spa, and marketing material.

loans.name: Muy

texts.en:
Muy and her husband came to the United States as refugees in 1981. They were farmers in Cambodia and in 1998, with the help of Fresno EOC Refugee Services microloan program, they started farming again on 15 acres. They continued farming together until 2010 when her husband passed away, at which point she let the farm go. She struggled with health issues during this time and her two daughters moved home to care for her.
 
In 2012, Muy was recovering and began to farm again on six acres. She sells her produce at the San Jose Swap Meet each week. During the winter months, she buys produce at wholesale prices to sell at the swap meet. She also delivers produce to restaurants in her box truck. During the summer, she is able to eliminate the purchase of produce by harvesting from her farm.
 
The purpose of this loan is to help Muy build a small hot house, which will extend her growing season, and to help her repair her tractor so that she doesn't have to pay others for tractor work.

loans.use: to repair her tractor and build a hothouse

loans.name: Joseluis

texts.en:
Joseluis began selling car care products out of his home in Visalia, California in 2010. He established a route selling to car dealerships, used car lots, and other auto-related businesses in the area. In 2012 Joseluis started his own product line "Prime Car Care Products" which he now sells alongside his other products. He’s excited to be distributing his own product and now he’s even more passionate about making the sales. 

Joseluis gets the finished product directly from the manufacturing company, he loads it onto his truck and conducts sales. His wife, Adelina keeps the books and helps with the administration of the business. There are no other employees, but they plan to hire another sales rep as they grow.

This $5,000 loan will allow Joseluis to purchase a broader set of inventory from his manufacturer (which he has to pay for up-front). He had been turned down by several banks prior to applying with Fresno CDFI due to fact that he's just now getting his new product onto the market. This loan will help Joseluis build business credit and eventually access loans from more traditional sources.

loans.use: to purchase car care products and build business credit

loans.name: Kodir

texts.ru: Кодир мудрый и интеллектуальный мужчина. Ему 39 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами 15 лет назад он начал свой бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культур и скотоводством. Он имеет большой опыт в этой сфере и развивает свой бизнес. Он выращивает пшеницу, ячмень и другие сельхоз культуры. Его жена помогает ему введение бизнеса. Он продает свой урожай местным жителям с первых рук по более низкой цене, чем на базаре. Дополнительно он работает учителем в сельской школе. Он имеет много учеников, которые очень грамотные и работают в различных сферах общества. Он хочет развивать бизнес и от полученного дохода улучшить условию проживания. Однако у него нет денег для покупки семена для нового посева и для покупки скота. Он с большой надеждой запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 Сомони для покупки семена  и скота. Он обещает погасить займ вовремя. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Kodir is a wise and intellectual man.  He is 39 years old and he is married with four children at home.  With the goal of providing for his family's needs, he started his business growing crops and raising livestock.  He has much experience in this line of work and he is increasing his business.  He grows wheat, barley and other crops.  Kodir's wife helps him run his business.  He sells his crops to the local residents directly for a lower price than in the bazaar.  To supplement his income, he works as a teacher in the village school.  He has many pupils who are very accomplished and who work in various sectors of society.  Kodir wants to increase his business and use the income to increase his standard of living.  At the same time, he has no money to buy seeds for his new crops or to buy livestock.  He awaits this loan of 5,000 Somoni with great hope to buy seeds and livestock.  He promises to repay the loan on time.  He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy seeds and cattle

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru:
Шухрат мужчина в возрасте  46 лет, проживает в сельской местности. Женат и имеет 4-х детей.  Супруга так же как и Шухрат не имеет высшего образования и занимается воспитание детей дома. В свободное от воспитания время она помогает своему супругу по выращиванию абрикосового сада, пшеницы и кукурузы.  Шухрат с юного возраста помогал своей семье по выращиванию различных злаковых культур. Спустя некоторое время, он арендовал землю на которой и по сей день трудится. По началу ему было очень тяжело, так как ему никто не помогал, кроме его супруги.  Шухрат узнал от своих знакомых , что МДО «Арванд» выдает кредиты. Он обратился в Арванд  и получил первый кредит в 2011 году.  Шухрат имеет не плохую кредитную историю. В этом году Шухрат снова планирует брать  кредит для покупки минеральных удобрений для выращивания пшеницы и абрикосового сада. 
 Он очень благодарен организации Арванд за то, что поддерживает низкий слой населения и желает этой организации  дальнейшего процветания.
texts.en: Shuhrat is a 46 years old and he lives in a village with his wife and four children.  Neither Shuhrat or his wife have a higher education and they both are involved in raising their children.  In his free time, Shuhrat helps his wife with their crops: apricots, wheat and corn.  From a very young age, Shuhrat helped his family grow various crops.  A short time later, he rented a plot of land on which he could sow crops.  At first it was very difficult since he didn't have anyone to help him but his wife.  Shuhrat found from some acquaintances that Arvand give loans.  He turned to Arvand and received his first loan in 2011.  Shuhrat has a good credit history.  This year, he plans to take out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer to use in his wheat and apricot fields.  He is very grateful to Arvand for their support of poor people and he wishes every success for this organization.

loans.use: to purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Zuhriddin

texts.ru: Зухриддин аккуратный и добрый молодой человек. Ему 21 года. Он женат  и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Дети маленькие. Его жена домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием детей. Зухриддин единственный кормилец в семье. У него старые и больные родители, и поэтому они не в состоянии помочь Зухриддину. Он более 5 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры и скотоводством. В этом году он не получил хороший урожай и поэтому он не смог сделать сбережения для нового посева. Он должен срочно сделать новый посев, но не имеет денег для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Он также планирует купить скот для расширения бизнеса. Он запрашивает займ в сумме 5000 сомони для покупки семена, минерального удобрения и скота. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется только на вас.
texts.en: Zuhriddin is a careful and kind young man. He is 21 years old, married and is raising two children. His children are small. His wife is a homemaker and raising children. Zuhriddin is the sole bread winner in the family. His parents are old and ill and are not able to help Zuhriddin. He has been cultivating crops and doing animal husbandry for more than five years. This year he did not collect a good harvest and that's why he was not able to save money for a new sowing. He needs to make a new sowing as soon as possible, but does not have money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. He also plans to buy cattle to expand his business. Zuhriddin is asking for a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer and cattle. He is waiting for your kindness and relies only on you.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer and cattle.

loans.name: Hakimjon

texts.ru: Хакимчону 37 лет. Он женат и отец четверых детей. У него две дочери и два сына. Хакимчон со своей семьей проживает в районе Бохтар в юго-западной части Таджикистана. Жена Хакимчона домохозяйка. Сам Хакимчон работает точильщиком ножей. На центральном рынке своего района он арендует мастерскую, где обслуживает своих клиентов. Он занимается этой деятельностью уже 6 лет. Сейчас Хакимчон хочет расширить свою деятельность и еще качественнее обслуживать людей. С этой целью он обратился за кредитом. Хакимчон просит кредит для приобретения точильных камней. За счет прибыли он хочет улучшить условия проживания семьи.
texts.en: Hakimjon is 37 years old. He is married and is a father of four children. He has two daughters and two sons. Hakimjon lives with his family in the Bohtar region in the southwestern part of Tajikistan. Hakimjon's wife is a homemaker. He works as a knife sharpener. He rents out a shop on the central market of his region where he serves his customers. He has been in this business for six years. Now Hakimjon wants to expand his business and provide a more quality service to his customers. He has come for a loan with this goal. Hakimjon is asking for a loan to buy sharpening stones. He wants to improve living conditions for his family using the profit from the loan.

loans.use: to purchase sharpening stones.

loans.name: Umida

texts.ru: Умида жизнерадостная женщина с тонким чувством юмора. Ей 41 года. Она разведена и имеет 1 ребенка. С мужем ей не повезло, так как он много лет назад бросил ее и их ребенка и женился на другой женщине. Он некогда не поддерживал ее с деньгами для содержания ребенка. Умида вырастила сына одна. Она работает в центральной больнице своего района медсестрой. Она выполняет свою работу честно и всегда имеет хорошую репутацию среди работников. Она очень хорошо ухаживает за больными. Ее зарплата ели-ели хватает на жизнь, и она не смогла сделать сбережения для проведения свадьбы сына. Ее сын хочет жениться, на любимой девушке и попросил мать по быстрее сыграть его свадьбу. Она долго думала и решила обратиться за займом в сумме 7500 сомони для проведения свадьбы. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Umida is a happy woman with a good sense of humor. She is 41 years old. She is divorced and has one child. She was not lucky with her husband as he has left her and their child many years ago and married another woman. He never supported her with money to help raise their child. Umida has raised her son alone.

Umida works in the central hospital of her region as a nurse. She does her job honestly and always has a good reputation among her coworkers. Umida takes good care of her patients. Her salary is barely enough to live on and she was not able to save money to hold a wedding for her son. Her son wants to get married to his beloved and asked his mother to have a wedding very soon. She has thought about it for some time and decided to ask for a loan in the amount of 7,500 somoni to hold the wedding. Umida is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to have a wedding for her son.

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru: Джурабеку 40 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Его жена работает в фермерском хозяйстве. Джурабек более 5 лет занимается производством столов, стульев, парты и т.п. Он в основном берет заказы от средних и частных школ. Его продукция имеет высокое качество, и большой спрос среди населения. Он любит свою работу и знает все тонкости своего дела. Его старший сын Джалолдин помогает ему введение бизнеса, он тоже мастер. Джурабек планирует развивать свой бизнес дальше, то есть производить столы и стулья не только для школ, но и для офиса. Он запрашивает займ в сумме 3000 доллара США для покупки древесина и других необходимых материалов для производства больше столов и стульев. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Jurabek is 40 years old and he is married with five children at home.  His wife works on a farm and for more than five years, Jurabek has been involved in the production of tables, chairs, desks, etc.  He mainly takes orders from high schools and private schools.  His furniture is of a high quality and there is much demand for it among the public.  Jurabek loves his work and he knows every little detail of what he does.  His elder son helps him run his business, as he is also a woodworker.  Jurabek plans to increase his business, so he will be able to make furniture not only for schools, but also for offices.  He is asking for a loan of 3,000 US dollars to buy lumber and other necessary materials to make more tables and chairs.  He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy wood and other materials to make tables and chairs

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana julia, tiene 39 años de edad su pareja le apoya en todo, sus tres hijos estudian, ella con su negocio les brinda lo necesario para su desarrollo, doña Ana vende ropa variada en el barrio, también tiene su propio establecimiento en el mercado desde hace muchos años lo que le ha permitido mejorar su vivienda con las ganancias. Este crédito que solicita es para invertir en su negocio comprando chinelas, bolsos para damas, ya que tiene mucha demanda por la temporada de verano y desea aprovechar al máximo esta oportunidad de financiamiento y así apoyar más a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Julia is 39 years old. Her partner supports her in everything.  Her three children are studying and with her business she is able to offer them everything they need for their education.

Ana sells assorted clothes in the neighborhood, and has had her own stand in the market for many years which allows her to improve her home with the income. She is asking for this loan to invest in her business, buying slippers and handbags, since there is high demand in summer and she wants to take maximum advantage of this opportunity for finance, and thus further support her family.

loans.use: to buy slippers and bags.

loans.name: Rayhona

texts.ru: Райхона порядочная и интеллектуальная женщина. Ей 31 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Ее дети несовершеннолетние и ходят в школу. Райхона хочет организовать свой бизнес купле продажей скота, так как она живет в сельской местности и имеет хорошие условия для скотоводства. Она имеет большой огород, где может выращивать сено для скота. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rayhona is an organizes and intelligent woman.  She is 31 years old and is married with three children at home.  Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation.  Her children are still minors and they attend school.  Rayhona wants to start a business buying and selling livestock, since she lives in a village and has good conditions in which to raise animals.  She has a large garden where she can grow hay for her animals.  Rayhona has taken the "To Get Ahead" course offered by the Association of Businesswomen and she received a certificate.  She is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy livestock to start her new business.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle to start a new business

loans.name: Eddy Andres

texts.es:
Eddy, de 58 años de edad, originario de León, acompañado, padre de 3 hijos,  de 6, 13 y 16 años de edad, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a vender y almacenar mariscos del que es propietario hace mas de 5 años, solo logro finalizar su sexto grado de primaria. Inicio su negocio con la ayuda de un amigo, quien le ayudo a establecer su propio negocio de Acopio de Marisco, luego con el tiempo el amigo decidió dejarle el negocio solo a el, ya que con mucho esfuerzo y arduo trabajo ha logrado mantener su negocio estable, se siente muy satisfecho porque  le genera ganancias a diario, cuenta con clientes fijos, este ha sido su primer negocio, cuenta con el apoyo de su compañero y sus  hijos, sus expectativas es incrementar sus ventas para obtener mejores ingresos.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar pescados, cangrejos, camarones, langosta, etc. el estima que este crédito le ayudaría a comprar mas maricos, con el objetivo de ir creciendo poco a poco en su negocio, dentro de sus planes futuros es seguir invirtiendo mas en la compra de marisco, una de sus metas próximas es poder cancelar el préstamo para luego volver a solicitar otro, su deseo es que sus hijos lleguen a culminar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Eddy, 58, is originally from León. He is in a relationship and has three children aged 6, 13 and 16. He studied up to the sixth grade of primary education. Eddy works as a salesman; he sells and stores seafood, a business he started more than five years ago with the help of a friend. With time, his friend decided to leave the business to Eddy, and he has managed to keep it running with effort and hard work. He feels satisfied because he has a daily income and loyal customers. This is Eddy’s first business and his partner and children support him. He hopes to increase his sales and profits.

Eddy is requesting a loan to buy fish, crabs, shrimps, lobsters, etc. He believes this loan will help him to buy more seafood with the aim to expand his business, step by step. His plans for the future are to continue investing in buying seafood. One of his short-term goals is to be able to pay the loan so that he can request another one. He dreams of the day when his children receive a university degree.

loans.use: to buy fish, crabs, shrimps, lobsters, etc.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Don Jorge Luis, es casado tiene dos hijos, su esposa es ama de casa, Jorge alquila un tramo en el mercado y en su casa tiene una pulpería que le ha generado buenas ganancias con lo que ha hecho posible mantener a su hijos en la escuela, ahora él desea invertir en mas productos y así ir creciendo poco a poco, por esta razón solicita este primer crédito para comprar granos básicos, gaseosa, carnes y productos lácteos, agradece esta oportunidad de crédito que viene a ayudarle mucho a su economía y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge Luis is married and has two children. His wife is a housewife. Jorge rents a space in the marketplace and has a grocery store at home, which has given him good profits to pay for his children’s education.

Jorge wants to invest in more products and expand his business, step by step. This is why he is requesting his first loan to buy grains, beverages, meat and dairy products. He appreciates this opportunity, something that will benefit his and his family’s economy.

loans.use: to buy grains, beverages, meat and dairy products.

loans.name: Guillermo Gilberto

texts.es:
Guillermo de 37 años de edad, originario de León, soltero, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio  de taller de vulcanización del que es propietario hace más de 2 años. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio a la edad de 35 años,  ya que necesitaba un medio del cual subsistir y generar ingresos por si solo, fue allí que decidió emprender su propio negocio de vulcanización y reparación de llantas para vehículos, se siente muy orgulloso porque este negocio le genera mucho  ingreso a diario, este ha sido su primer negocio, sus expectativas es seguir creciendo para ser reconocido como un empresario exitoso.
Guillermo esta necesitando el financiamiento para comprar una máquina para soldar, bomba de agua, llaves, cables para extensiones eléctricas, comprensor, etc. Con el objetivo de comprar todas las herramientas  que necesita  en su taller de vulcanización y  ofrecer un mejor servicios a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 37 years old. He is from León and is single. He is a merchant whose business is vulcanization. He has had this business for 2 years, starting when he was 35 years old. He needed a way to survive and generate income on his own and so he decided to start his own vulcanization business and tire repair business. He feels very proud because this business generates a lot of income for him every day. This is his first business and he hopes to keep growing and be recognized as a successful businessman.

Guillermo needs the loan to buy welding equipment, a water pump, wrenches, extension cords, a compressor, etc. His objective is to buying all of the tools he needs in his vulcanization shop and offering a better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy welding equipment, a water pump, wrenches, extension cords, a compressor, etc.

loans.name: Fatima Del Carmen

texts.es: Fátima una humilde joven con deseo de superación, de  23 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de mariscos de la que es propietaria hace mas de 6 años, soltera, orgullosa madre de 3 hijos de 6, 7 y 2 años de edad. Inicio en la actividad laboral desde muy joven,  es asi como se gana la vida la joven Fátima saliendo a vender todos los días bajo el sol, ella dice que su primera experiencia con credito Kiva fue beneficiosa esta muy  agradecida pues logro comprar mariscos y vender bastante pero lo mas importante es que logro formar su primer record crediticio que espera seguir manteniendo limpio para poder optar a financiamiento y seguir creciendo. En esta ocasion requiere el credito para para comprar todo tipo de pescados como guapote, tilapia, curvina, etc. Que son las diferentes especies de  pescados. Uno de sus planes futuros es comprar una camioneta para transportar sus productos y no depender de nadie, desea convertirse en una vendedora mayorista de mariscos.
texts.en: Fátima is a humble young woman who want to get ahead. She is 23 years old and sells seafood. She has had this business for 6 years. She is single and the proud mother of 3 children, aged 6, 7 and 2. She started this activity when she was very young. Fátima earns her living going out to sell under the sun every day. She says that her first experience with a Kiva loan was beneficial. She is very grateful because she was able to buy seafood and sell a lot, but the most important thing is that she established her first credit history that she hopes to keep clean to be able to take out loans and keep growing. At this time, she needs the loan to buy all kinds of fish, such as guapote, tilapia, sea bass, etc., which are the different types of fish. One of her future plans is to buy a pick-up truck to transport her products and not depend on anyone. She wants to become a seafood wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy all kinds of fish.

loans.name: Kyabagyerwa Church Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 54-year-old widow with nine children. She was happily married to her husband and in 1989 her husband died in an accident.
She looked for all possible ways to survive because she was staying in a semi-finished house and had no stable income. She then contacted the leader of her church who talked to his followers and they assisted her by sending her to a tailoring course. After the course she bought one tailoring machine and started a small business repairing clothes.
She developed that and now she has 4 tailoring machines which are helping her to boost her income. From her business income she has managed to send her children to school and even sustain the family with all their basic needs. She has finished working on her house and now she has hopes of developing her business into a tailoring training school. She will use the loan to buy another sewing machine to create employment for one extra person. She thanks UGAFODE for partnering with the group. She is confident her dreams will soon come true.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine so she is able to create employment for an additional person.

loans.name: Yessenia Maribel

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar vive la señora Yessenia, tiene 19 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad. Su esposo es oficial de un bus.
 
Doña Yessenia para poder ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a su marido con los gastos que generan sus hijos se dedica a la venta de alimentos, los fines de semana ella instala unas mesas en el centro del pueblo en la cual se dedica a vender tostadas, batidos de frutas, chifles con ensaladas entre otras cosas, lleva seis meses con su negocio pero que le está yendo muy bien y gracias  la crédito anterior pudo empezar con su negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas, pan, plátanos y otros víveres que ella necesita para preparar los alimentos. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias al  crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande y un local.
texts.en:
in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products such as paja toquilla hats known nationally and internationally, the members of the 4 De Noviembre communal bank meet every two weeks. 

Here lives Yessenia. She is 19 years old, married and the mother of two children, aged 4 and 2. Her husband is a bus officer. 
 
In order to earn something on her own and help her husband with the children's expenses,Yessenia sells food. Weekends she sets up some tables in the center of town where she sells tostadas, fruit smoothies, chifles and salads, among others. She has had her business for six months and it is going well for her and thanks to the previous loan, she was able to start her business.

This loan is to buy fruit, bread, plantains, and other groceries that she needs to make the food. She has been in her communal bank for two cycles and she likes it because thanks to the loan she started her business.
 
Her dream is to have a bigger business and a locale.

loans.use: to buy fruit, bread, plantains and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural and retail shop products.

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en: Seymur is a farmer and has been growing tomatoes and cucumbers since 2002. He is married and father of a small child. His wife is a housewife and helps him with his work. He started his business by planting tomatoes. Additionally, he has fruit trees and in parallel with tomatoes and cucumber he sells fruits. In the future, he wants to build a modern greenhouse. His personal plans include finishing construction on his home. Seymur needs your financial support to purchase seeds, fuel and fertilizer and plastic to protect his crops from the cold and wind.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fuel and fertilizer and plastic to protect his crops from cold and wind.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy embroidery supplies for her embriodery business.

loans.name: Loyola Group

texts.en:
Suraiya, who is in her early 30s, is married with three children, two boys and one girl, and all of them go to school. She has been running a beauty salon since 1992. She works from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock the missing items in the salon, to improve the salon interior by painting and adding more mirrors and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to buy a mattress and bed, to pay school fees and to start building her own house.  She will use this loan to buy more salon equipment. Her dream is to one day be able to own a car of her own.

Suraiya will use this loan with her loan group "Loyola", with 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie owns one point five hectares of rice field and also raises hogs. She has been a widow for two years, yet she is still a business-oriented woman. She would like to ensure the proper growth of her sow who's about to give birth so she could gain greater income.

Rosemarie is now requesting additional capital of PHP 20,000 which will allow her to buy necessary hog feed and vitamins for her sow. She hopes to obtain the said loan amount so she could sustain her sow with proper nutrition upon reaching it's maturity period. She is hoping that her livestock business will grow smoothly so she could let her youngest child finish her studies, and also to save for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Verna

texts.en:
Hog raising has been Verna's business involvement for four years. She is 39 years of age and married with two children who currently go to school. Her spouse is a farmer and at the same time a tricycle driver. The couple works hard in order to earn a living.

Verna would like to buy a stock of hog feed so she could economize on her fare expenses in going to and from the market. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000. She knows that this loan amount would help her most especially in raising her hogs well. She is hoping that her requested loan amount will be approved so she could provide her family with basic commodities and improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy stock hog feed of her raise hogs

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been operating a business of animal sales for the past three years. She started her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She is supporting her family of six members. With the help of her husband, she is running a successful business to lead a decent life.  

She buys animals (baby goats) at low prices and brings them up, while her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. Currently she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to purchase two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en:
Ms Sharifan is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of milk sales for the past 5 years. She has 5 calves, one cow and one buffalo in milk. She sells the milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She has one daughter and two sons who are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  

She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business through their support of it. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 35,000 to purchase one more buffalo and feed for its calves. She hopes to have an increase in her production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Joujam Group

texts.en:
Kimneihoi is 37 years old, married, and has four boys. Kimneihoi is the featured borrower member of Joujam Group and she is pictured with her hand raised. 

She and her husband sieve sand on the riverbank, which is close to the village, to make a living. Kimneihoi used to run a paan shop a couple of years ago, but it failed to succeed. The paan shop was closed down because customers did not pay back their debts and the shop couldn’t be managed anymore. 

Kimneihoi and her husband sieve sand/stones to earn money. The riverbank where they work is taken on rent for sieving purposes from the land owner at a high rate. They contribute equally with other sand sievers for the land and the excavator/loader because the rate for hiring the land/excavator is high and it is not affordable by only one person. They work under the scorching heat of the sun and there is no substitute for their business. They work as a team with other miners and share the profits. 

Kimneihoi says, “We cease work during the rainy season because water current is high and water level rises, which is risky.” They usually go back to work once the water level has decreased and the riverbanks are dry. They halt their activity in case of sickness and natural calamities but work almost all throughout the year. Their life does not allow for sickness.

Kimneihoi believes that with this loan, she will be able to contribute for another plot of land and the excavator/loader. This will eventually enable both of them to work harder and earn more. She is happy because she is able to get the financial help from a distant world. She wishes them victory and good wishes in their life.

loans.use: To pay for a share of a rented plot of land for sieving.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Ms Abida is a 40-year-old married woman. She and her husband have been successfully running a small general store at the corner of their house. She has eight years of experience in this field. Her husband assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market where he has maintained many contacts over the years.
