Abida is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Muneera

texts.en:
Ms Muneera is 42 years old and married. She has seven children - four daughters and three sons. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small factory. His income alone is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family members. This compelled Muneera to start her business of stitching clothes to contribute to the family income. She is very familiar with stitching techniques. 

She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation, and she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. Currently she requested a loan of Rs. 45,000 to purchase another sewing machine along with spools of thread. She has been in association with Kashf for six years and has shown excellent repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine along with spools of thread.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Ms Jameela is a 32-year-old woman and a mother of three. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of sewing gloves. She has been doing it for the past three years. She knows the techniques of sewing very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy a new machine with spools of thread and wool to meet up with the increasing demands of her customers. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new machine along with spools of thread and wool.

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Ms Rasheeda is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been running a small general store at the corner of her house for the past 10 months. She accepted the fact that if only her husband works for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household along with the educational needs of their children. That is why she started shopkeeping at home - in order to support her family well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she requested a loan of Rs.15,000 to purchase a stock of flour and grains and also packs of biscuits. In this way she will be able to meet with the increasing demand without fail. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with a good repayment history. Rasheeda hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of flour and grains and also packs of biscuits.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of three. 

She has been running a business of trading cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

Asia requested a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of cloth in different colors and designs, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to inflate her sales, which ultimately help in generating more cash. 

She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of cloth in different colors and designs, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 49-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children and is trying hard to fulfill their needs, including food, healthcare, clothing, and education.

She has been doing a business of sewing gloves for the past eight years. By now she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute in the family income. However, due to lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase another sewing machine with the spools of threads and wool in various colors. With this she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail.  

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine with the spools of threads and wool in various colors.

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en:
Kausar has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over two years now. She has six children; her four daughters help her in completing orders on time while her sons work in a factory. 

She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required materials. Today she is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and with gems or stones on shawls and cloths. 

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase more spools of thread and packs of sequins, beads and pearls in various colors. She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Kausar has taken up.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread and packs of sequins, beads and pearls in various colors.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Mrs. Farida is a married woman. She is a very talented seamstress and excels in her stitching work. She has received a lot of appreciation from her community. She has accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to pay for the household's expenses or for the educational needs of their children. 

Farida and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses. 

She has now requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase more thread along with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community members. 

Farida hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a high-quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more thread along with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Mrs. Zahida is a married woman who lives with her husband and six children in Punjab, Pakistan. For the last four years, she has been doing hand embroidery and operating this business with the support of her husband. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are very much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her continue her operations, Zahida has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way, she will be able to cater more consistently to her customers. She hopes that she will increase her income by targeting more customers. 

Zahida hopes that her children will have a bright future ahead. She is in her second loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She is very thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 8 hijos todos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo ya no trabaja está muy anciano y enfermo. 

Doña María tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres, ella y uno de sus hijos  tienen un puesto en un Mercado de Manta, allí  trabajan todos los días desde las 05h00 hasta las 16h00, aunque actualmente es su hijo el que va a vender ya que ella por la edad ya casi no puede. Este negocio es el sustento de toda la familia, llevan más de 15 años con su negocio y gracias a esto ellos han podido salir adelante.
 
Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque siempre le dan mucha ayuda para seguir adelante.
 
Su sueño es tener buena salud para ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
Los Bajos de Montecristi is a city known for its great diversity of typical goods, like, for example, the Panama hats that are widely known both inside and outside of the country.  The members of the communal bank 4 de Noviembre meet here every fifteen days.  

María lives in this place.  She is sixty-one years old, is married, and has eight children, all of whom are grown.  Three of her children still live in her house.  Her husband does not work; he is very old and sick.

María has a small business selling fruits and vegetables.  She has a stand in the Manta Market with one of her children; there, they work every day from 5AM until 4PM.  Presently, her son is the one that is doing the selling, since she is usually unable to do so because of her age.  This business sustains the entire family, and they have been in this business for more than fifteen years.  Because of this, María and her family have been able to move ahead.

This loan will be used to buy fruits and vegetables.  

She has been a member of the communal bank since it started, and she likes it because they always give her a lot of help to continue moving forward.  Her dream for herself and her family is to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Ms Zarina is a 35-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and for the past many years, she has been running a business of selling bed sheets, covers and pillows. She buys bed sheets in bulk from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

She requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of bed sheets, covers and spreads in different colors and designs to expand her inventory and attract more customers. Zarina expects a boost in her earnings with her loan. She plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of bed sheets, covers and spreads in different colors and designs to expand her inventory and attract more customers.

loans.name: Ansar

texts.en:
Ansar is a married woman.  She is a motivated mother of two children whom she wishes to provide with good quality food, education and clothing.

She has been in the business of sewing school bags for four years. She makes school bags in different and colors and sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good quality bags. She earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members and is contributing much to the family income, as her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to fulfill the needs of his family members.

For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of 10,000 PKR. The amount will be used to purchase material such as cloth and leather with packs of threads in various colors and in large quantity to cater to more customers without delay. 

She is hopeful to get an increase in her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use part of profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase material such as cloth and leather with  packs of thread in various colors and in large quantity.

loans.name: Bismillah

texts.en:
Mrs. Bismillah lives with a family of three members. Her husband has a job at a private company. Initially his income was enough to meet the family's daily expenses but with the extension of their family their expenses have increased. 

Therefore Bismillah decided to help her husband. She learned how to sew professionally and began sewing clothes in her home for the people of her community. She has become well-known in her vicinity and now earns enough money to contribute to the family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation.

Bismillah has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase more stitching materials such as packs of buttons, laces and zippers along with spools of thread in various colors. She expects a boost in her earnings and is eager to provide a better education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stitching materials such as packs of buttons, laces and zippers along with spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en:
Ms. Ruqia is a 33-year-old divorced woman. For many years, she has been operating an animal sales business with the help of brother. She has five calves and two cows. Her business is doing well enough to allow her to make a decent living. She has one daughter who goes to school.

Ruqia is working hard to support her family by herself rather than being a burden to her parents. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. 

Currently Ruqia has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase an additional cow. She expects a boost in her earnings and hopes to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Mrs. Robina is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of four children, one of whom goes to school. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of funds, she is unable to meet  the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason, Robina has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will enable her to create more revenue so she may able to generate a healthier income. She is in her first loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Sadeeqan

texts.en:
Sadeeqan is 43-year-old lady who enjoys doing hand embroidery. She started doing this work with her daughters. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory and she makes enough to contribute to the family income. Due to increased in demand for her embroidery designs, she is employing other women in her business. 

She has four children. Her husband is a laborer and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. To meet the orders of her customers on time, she needs to purchase more frames, needles, reels of threads and packs of sequins in various colors. For this she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to Kashf Foundation. This will help her to meet her customers’ demands consistently, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase more frames, needles, reels of threads and packs of sequins in various colors.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Ms. Rehana has expertise in stitching clothes and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over three years now. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required materials. Today she is proud to be famous in her community for her fine stitching. 

To cope with the orders of her customers she has requested another loan worth Rs. 35,000 to purchase a new sewing machine with spools of thread in various colors. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history. She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Rehana has taken up. She has two children; one is school-going while the other one assists her in completing orders on time.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Ms. Yasmeen is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. The man shown in the photo is Yasmeen’s husband.  They have gained seven years of experience in this field.  Her husband assists her by purchasing a stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years and is motivated to provide his family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

Yasmeen wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy a stock of flour, rice and sugar to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a stock of flour, rice and sugar to meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Kadie. She is married, with two children, the youngest being 13 years old. Her husband is a driver. They live in Waterloo, Sierra Leone, which is just outside the capital city of Freetown.

Kadie has owned a general merchandise store for the past ten years that sells miscellaneous items such as water, drinks, and cigarettes. She works from 7am to midnight. She started doing business because she did not go to school. She hopes to become an international businesswoman and open a big shop one day.  

Kadie will use the loan to purchase more inventory, such as water, palm oil, and drinks. She says that transportation and price inflation are some difficulties that she faces. She thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory, such as water, palm oil, and drinks.

loans.name: Lidia Alexandra

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar vive la señora Lidia, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 11, 9 y 3 año de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante. 

Doña Lidia tiene una pequeña fábrica de botones, con la ayuda de los créditos compro lo necesario para poder comenzar su negocio y en la actualidad ya cuenta con dos maquinas que sirven para elaborar estos productos. Todas las semanas ella entrega a comerciantes que luego los venden a exportadores en la ciudad de Manta para que los lleven a otros países y les den el terminado a los botones. Ella trabaja de lunes a sábado con la ayuda de una hermana a quien le paga un sueldo mensual. Lleva cuatro años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito para seguir aumentando su negocio, con las ganancias que le quedaron ella las utilizo para comprar materia prima ya que con el invierno escasea y se opone más cara por lo cual con lo que tiene en reserva le van a quedar mejores ganancias. Este crédito es para comprar tagua para elaborar los botones. Lleva 7 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella pudo comprar lo necesario para poder tener su fábrica.
 
Sus sueños son tener una empresa mucho más grande y maquinarias para tener un producto terminado.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products such as the straw hats known inside and outside of the country, every 15 days the members of the communal bank 4 de Noviembre meet.

Lidia lives in this place. She is 35 years old and married, and from this relationship she has three children who are 11, 9, and 3 years old. The two oldest children study in school. Her husband is a merchant.

Lidia has a small button factory. With the help of previous loans, she bought what was necessary to be able to begin her business, and currently she has two machines that create these products. Every week, she turns over her buttons to merchants that then sell them to exporters in the city of Manta, who then bring these buttons to other countries to finish. She works from Monday through Saturday with the help of a sister to whom she pays a monthly salary. She has worked in this business for four years, and it is going very well for her.

She is applying for a loan again to continue enlarging her business. She utilized the profits that she was left with to buy raw materials because with the winter scarcity they will become more expensive. This is why with what she has in reserve she will be left with better profits. This loan is to buy tagua palm to make the buttons. She has been with the communal bank for seven years and she likes this bank because, thanks to the loans, she was able to buy what was necessary for her to be able to have her factory.

Her dream is to have a much bigger company and machinery to be able to create a finished product.

loans.use: to buy tagua palms.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony lives in the Paynesville south area. He is 58 years old, married and has four children between 10 and 28 years old; one lives on its own and the others live at home. All four of them attend school.

Anthony is a high school graduate. For the past nine years, he has been running a shop where he sells soda drinks, soap, chloride, tissues, juice, biscuits, candy, batteries, spray, alcoholic drinks and many other items. He started this business from his savings at the time he worked as a driver, and learned this way of running business from his friends. A problem he faces is electricity; he has to run a generator that is costly. He likes his business because it makes him popular and have enough money to spend daily. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase more soda drinks, chloride, tissues, juice, biscuits, candy, batteries, spray, alcoholic drinks and other items for his business. His plan is to expand his business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more soda drinks, chloride, tissues, juice, biscuits, candy, batteries, spray, alcoholic drinks and other items for his business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 33 years old and lives in Paynesville, one of the densely populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and has two children, aged 8 and 14 years old. They all live at home and the children attend school.

Martha stopped her education at the 11th grade, but she is good at managing her business. Her husband is a businessman. For the past 12 years she has been selling used clothes in the local market, and now she faces no problems. She sells every day and spends 9 hours with her business. She started this business with a little sum she received from her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business. She hopes to build herself a house.

loans.use: to purchase  used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Please meet 30-year-old Isatu from Waterloo, Sierra Leone.  She is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 13 years old.  All of her children are going to school.  Her husband is a driver.

Isatu has a business selling general foodstuffs such as palm oil, sugar, flour and tomato paste.   After completing her secondary education, she decided to join her mother in doing business.   She started her own business seven years ago.  She works 10 hours per day, 7 days per week throughout the month.  With the loan, she intends to buy more inventory for her business, such as palm oil, flour, sugar, rice, Maggi and tomato paste.  In five years, she wants to expand her business to have employees and her own storage place.  She says that storage and transportation of the goods from the purchasing shop to her business are challenges she faces.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her business, such as palm oil, flour, sugar, rice, Maggi and tomato paste.

loans.name: Safiatu

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Safiatu. She is divorced and has 1 child, aged 11 years. She has 2 additional dependents who live with her because of schooling.  In 2005, Safiatu established her cosmetic and drinks business. She began her business because she wanted to generate income and to help her family. Her business is located in the outskirts of town, and her main customers are from the general community. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Safiatu requires a loan in order to buy more cosmetics and drinks to sell. She hopes that this loan will support her to increase her profit. In the future, Safiatu plans to develop her business, build houses, and give a quality education to her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and drinks to sell

loans.name: Esheka

texts.en:
Please meet 47 year old Esheka from Sierra Leone.  He is married with two children, aged 6 and 8.  Both of his children currently attend school. He is also caring for two relatives. 
Esheka has a business selling rice, palm oil and groundnuts in Waterloo, located just outside the capital city of Freetown.  He started his business 22 years ago when his father lost his business.  He works 12 hours per day, 7 days per week.  He wants to use the loan to buy more rice, gari, palm oil, ginger and peppers.  He wants to grow his business to become a distributor for all type of local foodstuff and to employ other people in the business.  He says that low capital and transportation of the goods from the production site are his major challenges.  He is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more rice, gari, palm oil, ginger and peppers.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana specializes in making 'Ahe' (a traditional Ghanaian soft drink made primarily from maize). She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a driver.  The family lives in in Nyame Bekyer (near Cape Coast). Nana has been working as an 'Ahe' seller for close to six years. Her income helps her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. Nana plans to use her loan to purchase an increased quantity of maize, thus allowing her to meet her customers’ rising demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a drink stand, which would allow her to sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more maize to meet customers’ demands.

loans.name: Maame Esi

texts.en:
Maame Esi is married to a mechanic. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as to save for a rainy day. A junior high school  graduate, Maame currently sells onions and tubers (yams), in Nyame Bekyere (near Cape Coast).

With over two years of experience in her trade, Maame sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Therefore, she will use her loan to buy more onions and tubers, which will indirectly help her boost her overall sales. Maame wants to make her business self-sustaining, as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more onions and tubers (yams) to sell.

loans.name: Paskali

texts.en:
Paskali, now 57 years of age, used his previous loan to buy and stock more goods to sell in his retail shop.It was profitable and he was able to repay the full loan amount in good time.

This will be his fourth loan term with KADET LTD and he plans to use the loan to buy stock including maize flour, sugar, crates of bread, tealeaves and detergents to sell.  

He hopes to grow his business and open a wholesale shop, to earn more income and thereby become financially stable as well as to be able to pay school fees for his grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, sugar, crates of bread, tealeaves and detergents.

loans.name: Betty Margarita

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar vive la señora Betty, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 10 y 5 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es ebanista.

Doña Betty para ayudar a su esposo y con esto contribuir con los gastos del hogar realiza el crédito para que él lo invierta en su pequeño taller de ebanistería, allí él le da forma a la madera y elabora todo tipo de muebles como camas, cajoneras, repisas entre otros productos, fabrica bajo pedido que le realizan sus clientes y también en ocasiones entrega en Manta en una mueblería de esa ciudad, lleva más de 4 años con su taller y con eso el lucha para que nada les falte a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar madera, pintura, clavos y otros materiales más para elaborar sus obras. Lleva tres años   en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede ayudar a su marido
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products such as the straw hats known inside and outside of the country, every 15 days the members of the communal bank 4 de Noviembre meet.

Betty lives in this place. She is 31 years old and married, and from this relationship she has two children who are 10 and 5 years old and in school. Her husband is a cabinetmaker.

To help her husband and contribute to the home expenses, Betty is requesting the loan for him to invest in his small cabinetmaking workshop. There, he forms the wood and creates all kinds of furniture, such as beds, bureaus, and shelves, among other products. He works by requests from his customers and also on occasion he delivers to a furniture store in the city of Manta. He has labored in his workshop for more than four years, and with this he struggles so that his family wants for nothing.

This loan is to buy wood, paint, and nails, among other materials needed to create his products. She has been with the communal bank for three years, and she likes it because with the loans she is able to help her husband.

Her dream is to give the best to her small children.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, nails, and other materials.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children and runs a food cafe which has been in operation for three years.  Brenda employs two other people in the business.

Brenda was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 26,300 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, etc.

Despite the high level of bad debts, Brenda believes she can save her extra income for the education of her children, provide a means of income to the other employees, and also use part of the money to open a larger cafe.

loans.use: To buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Kalama Peter

texts.en:
Kalama Peter is 35 years old, married, and has four children who attend school.  She lives in Juba and runs a general store, which she has been doing for seven years. She has two employees. 

Kalama Peter is requesting a loan for 3,000 SSP, which she will use to purchase water, beer, and other items.  She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.  In five years, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase water, beer, soda, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 38-year-old businessman, who lives in Yei. He is married and has three children, between the ages of 3 and 9 years. All of them go to school. Joseph runs a clothing sales business. He has been in business for six years. He has no employees. His major business challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs.

He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 2,000 SSP, which he will use to purchase more clothes to sell in his business. He has no source of income besides this business.

Within five years, Joseph would like to expand his business and open other branches. He says he is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Saingo

texts.en: Saingo is an 81-year-old married woman with 3 children, ranging in age from 7 years to 20 years.  She describes herself as an ambitious and determined woman.  She operates a farm stand and retail store where she sells cereals, such as beans, sugar, salt, and rice.  She has been involved in this business for 3 years.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of cereals.  She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy beans to sell.  Her business goal is to be a supplier of cereals within 5 years.  This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy beans to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 39-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as focused. 

She operates a poultry business and farm where she sells chickens. 

She describes her biggest challenge as insufficient water for home use. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by her family. 

Her business goal is to improve her poultry and farming business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 32-year-old married man. He has a child who is three years old. He describes himself to be patient. 

Samuel operates a barber shop where he provides haircut services. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located at a favorable business area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds for expanding the business. Samuel will use the KES 34,100 loan to purchase a fridge and water dispenser. 

Samuel’s business goal is to run another barber shop within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge and water dispenser

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is single and rents a house with electricity and piped water.  For the last three months he has been supplying mineral water to retail shops and hawkers around him.  He aspires to open and own a big wholesale business.  He is requesting Kshs 20,000 to buy more cartons of mineral water to expand his supply.

loans.use: to buy cartons of mineral water.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif is 39 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. He is a father of one son and two daughters. He has been selling dates in the area and that is the only source of income for his family. He is sustaining his family life with many hurdles because his monthly income is very low. He wants to increase his net income by purchasing more products for his shop. For that reason he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the help of the profit he will purchase a house to offer a comfortable life to his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase dates to resell.

loans.name: Phylisia

texts.en:
Phylisia lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three children, although only two are in school. She owns a retail shop, a business which has been running for three years. In the business, she sells household goods and other items. She currently does this through hawking.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are bad debts and exhaustion from walking long distances.

Phylisia is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to buy retail stock like utensils, toothpaste, toys, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family and pay school fees for her children. She aspires to open a shop with a fixed location.

loans.use: To buy retail stock like utensils, toothpaste, toys, etc.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a 42-year-old mother of three. She is married and she lives together with her husband and children in the rural built house in Samburu Kenya. The house is solar powered and has tapped water. She owns a stall to sell clothes.

She has asked for a loan amounting to KES 26,000 to buy bundles of clothes. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo operates a fish selling business, which has been operational for years. With the loan of Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. 

She dreams of expanding and establishing a depot for selling fish in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 30 years old and is married to Hussein. They have three children. Halima is a street vendor who sells women's clothing. She has been in this business since 2011. Through their respective jobs, both contribute to household expenses in their effort to get ahead.

Halima is requesting for a loan of Ksh 20000 to buy lesos (women wrap clothing) for sale . This will allow her to have a wider variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy lesos (women wrap cloth) for sale .

loans.name: Laura Estela

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar vive la señora Laura, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 17, 10, 9 y 5 años de edad, el mayor ya termino el colegio y espera continuar la universidad en este año y los otros estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo trabaja ocasionalmente.
 
Doña Laura para poder salir adelante junto a su familia  y con esto ayudar a su marido ya que él a veces no trabaja se dedica a la venta de alimentos, los fines de semana ella instala un pequeño local en una cancha que hay en la localidad donde muchas personas asisten los fines de semana a hacer deporte, allí ella vende empanadas, sanduches, sodas, aguas, y varias cosas más, lleva más de seis años dedicada a este negocio y es gracias a esto que no les falta nada a sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar carne, queso, plátanos, sodas, aguas y otros víveres que ella necesita para preparar los alimentos. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y le da mucha ayuda. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Los Bajos de Montecristi is a city known for its great diversity of typical products, like, for example, the Panama hats that are widely known both inside and outside of the country.  The members of the communal bank 4 de Noviembre meet here every fifteen days. 

Laura lives in this place.  She is thirty-eight years old, is married, and has four children, ages 17, 10, 9, and 5.  The eldest has already finished high school and hopes to continue to study at the university this year; the others are in high school and primary school.  Her husband works occasionally.  

In order to move forward with her family and to help her husband (since he sometimes does not work), she makes a living selling food items.  On the weekends, she sets up a small stand on a soccer field in the community where many people go on the weekends to play sports.  There, she sells empanadas, sandwiches, soda, water, and several other items.  She has been doing this for more than six years, and it is thanks to this that her children are not in need of anything. 

This loan is to buy meat, cheese, plantains, soda, water, and other supplies that she needs in order to prepare her food items.  She has had three cycles of loans with the communal bank, and she likes it because the group is very united and offers her a lot of help.

Her dream is for her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy meat, cheese, plantains, soda, water, and other supplies.

loans.name: Hina

texts.en:
Ms. Hina is 21 years old and she has been running a small shop of dressmaking supplies for several years. By this time, she has become famous for providing good quality materials and makes enough to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. 

For this reason Hina requested a loan of Rs 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Mirbafo

texts.ru: Мирбафо житель города Истаравшан, расположенный в северной части Таджикистана. Ему 29 лет. Он женат и у него две дочери и один сын. Мирбафо работает токарем по дереву. Он занимается деревообделочной работой уже более 8 лет и является профессионалом своего дела. Сейчас Мирбафо хочет расширить свою деятельность. С этой целью он запрашивает кредит для приобретения лесоматериалов.
texts.en: Mirbafo lives in Istaravshan, which is located in the northern part of Tajikistan. He is 29 years old, married, and has 2 daughters and 1 son. He works as a woodturner. For over 8 years, he has been employed in woodwork and is a professional in this field. Mirbafo now wants to expand his business. To this end, he is seeking a loan to purchase lumber.

loans.use: to purchase lumber

loans.name: Pura Soveida

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo cada quince días  se reúne el Banco Comunal Esfuerzo y Poder, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Pura, tiene 58 años de edad, está separada pero  de esta relación tienen tres hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes.
 
Doña Pura es una mujer muy luchadora que para salir adelante sola sin depender de nadie se dedica al comercio desde hace más de 25 años, con su esfuerzo pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos y ahora le sirve para su propio sustento, ella instala un pequeño kiosco en una de las vías del cantón y allí vende ropa, zapatos, zapatillas y todo tipo de bisutería, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00. Es así como ella se gana la vida y se entretiene a la vez.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos y bisutería para surtir aun más su negocio. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho para salir adelante. 

Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The communal bank Esfuerzo y Poder [Effort and Power] meets every fifteen days in the canton of Olmedo.  This place is known for its beautiful landscapes and for its hardworking people, who are dedicated to agriculture and raising animals.

Pura lives in this area.  She is fifty-eight years old and is separated, although she does have three children through that relationship.  Her children are older and independent.

Pura is a very fighting woman who, to move ahead without depending upon anyone, has made a living in trade for more than twenty-five years.  With her efforts, she was able to get ahead with her children and now, she is able to sustain herself.  She sets up a small shop in one of the roads of the canton, and there she sells clothing, shoes, sandals, and every type of imitation jewelry.  She works every day from 8AM to 6PM.  In this way, she makes a living and sustains herself.       

This loan is to purchase clothing, shoes, and imitation jewelry to stock her store.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and likes it because the loans have helped her get ahead.

Her dreams are to have good health and to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and imitation jewelry.

loans.name: Midius

texts.en:
Midius used her previous loan to buy cattle that she grazed on a fattening diet for a period of six months and then sold off at a profit. She used her profit to pay her children's tuition and also bought some items to sell in her retail shop. Her loan has increased her capital base. 

Midius is requesting a 1,500,000 UGX loan to buy more cattle to raise and sell at a profit. She is a hardworking and profit-oriented woman. Midius thanks lenders for partnering with her during the previous loan and is confident of maintaining her partnership with Ugafode.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Julia Monserrate

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo cada quince días  se reúne el Banco Comunal Esfuerzo y Poder, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 

En este lugar vive la señora Julia, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 5 hijas mayores de edad, una de sus hijas aun vive con ella. Su marido es comerciante.

Doña Julia junto a su esposo se dedican al comercio, venden ropa de todo tipo para lo cual todos los días instalan un pequeño kiosco en una de las vías del cantón, trabajan todos los días pero los días que más venden son los fines de semana ya que son los días de feria y es cuando llegan hasta la ciudad las personas del campo a abastecerse de productos.  Compran su mercadería en  Guayaquil o recibe en su kiosco cuando llegan comerciantes a entregar al por mayor, llevan más de 4 años en este negocio el cual es la fuente de su sustento diario.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas, ropa interior y de niños para surtir aun más su negocio. Lleva más de cinco ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho.
 
Su sueño es tener un buen local.
texts.en:
The Esfuerzo y Poder communal bank meets every 15 days in the Olmedo canton.  This place is known for its beautiful scenery and for its hard-working people who work in agriculture and raise animals.

This is where Julia, age 59, lives.  She is married, and they have five grown daughters.  One of them still lives with her.  Her husband is a merchant.

Julia and her husband sell all types of clothes together.  They set up a small kiosk on one of the roads in the canton.  They work every day.  However, they sell the most on the week-ends because they are the fair days.  That is when even people from the country come to the city to stock up on products.

They buy their merchandise in Guayaquil or they receive it at their kiosk when merchants come to deliver wholesale.  They have been in this business for four years, and it is the source of their daily support.

They will use this loan to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, underwear, and children’s clothes in order to stock their business even more.  She has been in the communal bank for five years.  She likes it because the loans have helped her a lot.

Her dream is to have a good place.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, underwear, and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Juana Julia

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo cada quince días  se reúne el Banco Comunal Esfuerzo y Poder, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 6 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su marido es comerciante.

Doña Juana es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para el negocio de su marido, su esposo se dedica a la venta de agua de coco y gaseosas, él tiene una carreta en la cual todos los días se dedica a la venta de estos refrescos en el centro de la ciudad,  trabaja todos los días desde hace mas de 20 años en esta actividad y es así como él ha podido sacar adelante a su familia a punta de trabajo honrado y duro.

Este crédito es para comprar cocos y gaseosas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos poco a poco ha construido su casa.

Su sueño es terminar por completo su casa.
texts.en:
The communal bank Esfuerzo y Poder [Effort and Power] meets every fifteen days in the canton of Olmedo, a place known for its beautiful landscapes and for its hardworking people, who make a living in agriculture and raising animals.  

Juana lives here.  She is fifty-eight years old, is married, and has six children who are older and independent.  Her husband is a tradesman.  

Juana is a very good wife and requests the loan for the business of her husband.  Her husband makes a living selling coconut water and carbonated beverages.  He has a cart that he uses to sell these refreshments every day in the center of the city.  He has worked every day for more than twenty years in this business.  Through this honest and hard work, he has been able to move his family ahead.  

This loan will be used to buy coconuts and carbonated beverages.  Juana has been a member of the communal bank since its beginning, and she likes it because the loans, little by little, have allowed her to construct her house.

Her dream is to completely finish her home.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and carbonated beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy seeds and also hire labour

loans.name: Artur

texts.en: Artur is engaged in an agricultural business, which is the main source of the family's income. Artur keeps a cow, seven pigs and 10 piglets, and he grows tomatoes, eggplant and peppers. Artur also owns an orchard with peach, apricot, plum and apple trees. He works hard to reap good harvests and sell them in the local markets. But, unfortunately, his income is barely enough to  sustain a family of five: his parents, his wife, two daughters and a son. Artur has applied for this loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds for cultivation, forage for livestock and three oxen. This loan is very important for Artur to enlarge his agricultural activity and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds for cultivation, forage for his livestock and three oxen.

loans.name: Dominica

texts.en:
Dominica is 55 years old and married to a farmer. The couple is blessed with three children. Two of her children are married and the other one is working. Dominica is a farmer and, eight years ago, invested her income in a livestock business. She is currently raising 10 piglets, fattening two pigs, and has a sow. 

Dominica is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy livestock supplies such as hog feed, vitamins, and vaccines to ensure proper nutrition for her pigs. She would like to increase her sales and profit to have a comfortable lifestyle and a viable source of income. Dominica hopes and pray that lenders will continue to support her financially so she can become a good entrepreneur someday.
.

loans.use: to buy livestock supplies such as hog feed, vitamins, and vaccines to ensure proper nutrition for her pigs

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 37 years old and is married to Christine--they have two children. He also takes care of four dependents whose parents have passed away; he provides them with all basic needs, including paying their school tuition from the little income he generates from his business.

He started this business in 2005 as a source of income to support his family and educate his children. He has managed the business for such a long time because of the quality products he makes from his textile business.

He has a dream of expanding his business by developing it into a medium sized textile company, hence increasing his output and income.
His major challenge is inadequate funds to boost his business and the capacity to buy enough raw materials.  He has requested a loan of UGX  2,000,000  to put into the business to be able to meet his clients' demands. 

His neighbors commend that Godfrey is a very hardworking, determined business man and a servant of God.

loans.use: To buy more cloth/materials

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles lives in Katyaza  with his wife and family of 3 children. He also has  two other dependents. 

He has a music system that he hires out to people who have different functions/events. That is his main source of income. He also sells cola drinks, which gives him an additional source of income. He has requested for this loan for stocking drinks for the shop. His dream is to be able to buy a second music system to hire out since it is a promising business and can be quite profitable.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks for his shop

loans.name: Kisaakye Kimwanyi Group

texts.en: Besi is a single mother of 38. She has four children and three dependents who all attend school. She sells charcoal to the low income people in one of the city slums–Katanga–and she also does tailoring to supplement her income as her side business. She took out a loan of 200,000 UGX for the purpose of restocking charcoal to sell during the Easter season. Her main clients are her neighbors and well-wishers. Her major challenge is bad weather: during the rainy seasons vehicles can’t go to the villages to collect charcoal, which  reduces her supplies to sell to her customers. Her hopes for the future are to see her children prosper and to continue to borrow more money from Ugafode to sustain her business and pay for her children's tuition.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ukay ukay (used clothes, shoes and bags) to sell.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en: Janice is 25 years old, single, and lives at Rizal with her parents. They have a furniture-making business as the family's source of income. She manages it very well. She also pay laborers who help them in the business. Janice usually earns PHP 30,000 each month, which she uses as revolving capital in the business and for education expenses of her younger brothers and sisters. Janice is applying for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more wood that is needed to make cabinets, tables and chairs. Janice hopes to continuously make high quality products and make the business more profitable. Some day, it will lead their business to progress and permit them to achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to buy more wood for her family's furniture-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dana (a material used in making plastic products) for resale in her son’s business.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante is 59 years old and runs his retail business well with the help of his wife. He sells fish and various kinds of vegetables that he grows. Dante is thankful that he is still able to run his business well. He wants to keep his business productive and profitable but struggles with the shortage of capital.

Dante is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy vegetable seeds, fish, and additional items for his store. He hopes that his loan will help improve his vegetable production and sales to obtain greater income. Dante is looking forward to the approval of his loan so he can sustain his family, provide basic necessities, and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fish, and additional items for his store

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a widow who lives with her three children in rural Lyantonde. She is an agriculturalist who rears cattle and later sells them. 

For over three years she has acquired loans that she has paid back well because her business is profitable. She also has customers for her cows because she is a social woman. She has been able to educate her three children out of the proceeds from the business and hopes they will soon go to higher levels of learning. She is very hard working.

loans.use: To buy young bulls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and cola

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a 52-year-old man who lives in Kyemamba with his family. He is married and has 10 children aged between 3 and 20 years old. He also takes care of 5 other people in his home. He is a cattle keeper who  buys calves, breeds them for a period of 3 to 6 months and then sells them in different markets. Vincent's wife helps him take care of the cows. In addition to income from the sale of the cows, he also gets milk from them. He also has a banana plantation that gives him additional income. Vincent's desire is to have many more cattle than he currently has. He says that cattle fattening is a very lucrative business. From the sale of one cow, he is able to pay school fees for all his school-going children. 

During the dry season he has the challenge of traveling long distances in search of water.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Los Claveles  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Los Claveles que se reúne cada quince días en Portoviejo, ciudad bella y hospitalaria conocida como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, con muchos atractivos turísticos y con una variedad exquisita en su gastronomía.

Este es un grupo formado por 15 mujeres y 1 hombre los mismos que desde hace tiempo atrás decidieron unirse y recibir la ayuda que el banco les da con los créditos,  ellos se dedican a diversas actividades como el comercio, venta de comida y también a la prestación de servicios.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Lorena, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 12 y 8 años que estudian en colegio y  escuela. Su esposo trabaja en el camal municipal.

Doña Lorena tiene una tienda en su casa donde vende víveres, sodas, helados, ropa y  artículos de bazar, ella trabaja sola todos los días aunque en ocasiones cuando  tiene que salir a algún lugar su hermana le ayuda en su trabajo pero esto es ocasionalmente, lleva más de 10 años con su negocio y esto le sirve para salir adelante ya que su esposo no gana mucho y los gastos son muy grandes.

Este crédito es para surtir aún más su tienda, va a  comprar víveres y artículos de bazar. Este es su primer ciclo en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y  sin tantos requisitos.
 
Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Los Claveles [The Carnations] meets every fifteen days in Portoviejo, a beautiful and hospitable city known as the City of Real Tamarinds that has many tourist attractions and an exquisite variety in its gastronomy.

This group is made up of fifteen women and one man who, some time ago, decided to unite themselves in order to receive the help of a bank through loans.  They make a living in diverse activities, like in trade, selling food, and also in offering services.  

One of the members of this group is Lorena.  She is thirty-seven years old, is married, and has two children, ages 12 and 8.  They study in high school and in primary school.  Her husband works in the city slaughterhouse.  

Lorena has a store in her home where she sells supplies, soda, ice-cream, clothing and bazaar items.  She works alone every day, although when she needs to go somewhere, her sister helps her at the store; however, this is only occasionally.  She has had this business for more than ten years, and this helps her to get ahead since her husband does not make a lot of money and they have a lot of expenses.

This loan is to stock her store with more items; she is going to buy supplies and items for the bazaar.  This is her first cycle with the communal bank, and she likes it because the loans are quick and do not have a lot of requirements.  

Her dream is to continue growing her business.

The small inserted photo is of a member that could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy supplies and bazaar items.

loans.name: Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Upendo is in her early 40s and is married with a boy and three girls, all of whom are in school. Since 2009, Upendo has been running a dairy business and she has her own milk cows. Her business is doing well and she optimistic that it will succeed. Her previous business, selling fabrics, did not do well. Upendo works every day from nine in the morning until six at night and is able to make a fair profit each month. She will share her loan with her loan group "Uvumilivu," which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. 

Upendo will use her portion of the loan to buy a cow. This will be her 20th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She successfully repaid her previous loans and has been able to start her dairy business, cover her household expenses, and pay school fees for her children. Upendo dreams of one day owning a nice family car.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 30-year-old lady who lives in Kicwamba with her family. She has 2 children, ages 5 and 3. Her business is both a restaurant and a bar at her home.

Lydia would love to build a house so that she has a separate premise from the business. Her dream is therefore to build a house and separate the business from the home. She hopes that  she will then be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of drinks

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 36-year-old, married woman, living with her six children and her husband. The income of her husband is not enough to fulfill the basic needs of the family members, including food, clothes, and quality education. 

Due to the low income of her husband, Tahira decided that she will help her husband and will contribute to her household income.  For this purpose, she started a general store, at the corner of her house, for the people of her community. She has gradually improved her business, with the support of Kashf Foundation, and has attained a regular list of customers. 

Currently, she requests a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages. She is in her sixth loan cycle, with good repayment history. Tahira expects a boost in her earnings and dreams to provide quality education to her children for their prosperous, bright future.

loans.use: to purchase packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Ufunuo Group

texts.en:
Anita is in her early 30s and is a single woman with one kid who attends school. Since 2008, she has run a business selling clothing. Anita works four hours each day and is able to make a good monthly profit and provide for her family's daily needs. She will share her loan with her loan group, "Ufunuo," which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

Anita is requesting a loan to buy more clothing to sell. This will be her fourth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Anita successfully repaid her previous loans that she used to restock her store and buy new clothing brand. She has been able to use the profit from her previous loans to buy a plot of land, make some bricks to prepare for building a house, cover her home expenses, and pay school fees. In the future, Anita dreams of expanding her business and building a nice family house.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Oidinoy

texts.ru: Ойдиной жительница Яванского района. Ей 29 лет. Она разведена и имеет одного ребенка. Ойдиной работает на двух работах. Она занимается земледелием в течение 4 года. У нее имеется дехканское хозяйство, где она выращивает различные виды овощей и зерновые. Дехканское хозяйство это небольшое индивидуальное или коллективное частное хозяйство в котором работают несколько людей и где в основном выращивают хлопок, пшеницу или овощи - которые занимают 60% орошаемых земель в Таджикистане. Одновременно Ойдиной на рынке своего района занимается торговлей тканями. Сейчас Ойдиной запрашивает кредит для приобретерния семян овощей и минеральных удобрений. За счет прибыли с урожая она планирует создать фруктовы сад и поставить заборы вокруг своего недавно построенного дома.
texts.en: Oidinoy lives in the Yavan Region. She is 29 years old. She is divorced and has one child. Oidinoy has two lines of work. She has been farming for four years. She has a small "dekhan farm," where she grows various vegetables and grains. A “dekhan farm" is a small individual or collective private farm employing a small number of people; such farms mainly produce cotton, wheat or vegetables-which take up 60% of arable land in Tajikistan. Additionally, Oidionoy sells fabric at the local market. At present Oidinoy is requesting a loan in order to buy vegetable seeds and mineral fertilizers. She plans to use the revenue from her harvest to plant a fruit orchard and  put up fences around her recently built house.

loans.use: to buy various vegetable seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Elizabeth Guadalupe

texts.es: Doña Elizabeth de 38 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa(blusas, pantalones y camisas) vive en casa propia sola con sus dos hijos, Doña Elizabeth con la venta de ropa ha logardo sacar a delante a sus hijos y tambien poder llevarles el sustento diario, ella solicita un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y poder tener mas ingresos para seguir llevando lo necesario a su hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Elizabeth is 38 years old and makes a living selling clothes (blouses, pants and shirts). She lives alone in her own house with her two children. Her clothing sales have enabled her to feed her children and help them get ahead.  

Doña Elizabeth is requesting a loan in order to purchase more merchandise and increase her income so that she can continue to provide her household with the necessities.

loans.use: to acquire working capital to purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: La Anona Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios uno de ellos es José tiene 21 años de edad, padre soltero con un hijo menor, desde hace ocho años tiene su negocio de un taller de carpintería, en sus negocio tiene cuatro familiares  y uno es remunerado, el crédito lo  invertirá en la compra de materia prima como madera de robles, sellador, sener, junco, lijadora, clavos etc.Mayerlis tiene 34 años de edad su negocio es compra y venta de sandillas, y Denis tiene 34 años de edad compra y vende sandillas.
texts.en: This group is made up of three members. José, 21, is a single father with a young child. He has had his carpentry workshop for more than eight years. Four family members work in his business and one of them is paid. He will use the loan to buy raw materials like oak wood, sealant, thinner, reeds, a sander, nails, etc. Mayerlis, 34, buys and sells sandals and Denis, 34, buys and sells sandals.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like oak wood, sealant, thinner, reeds, a sander, nails, etc.

loans.name: Santos Eustacio

texts.es:
El señor Santos, de 60  años de edad,  vive con su esposa  en su casa de habitación ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica a la venta de ladrillos y tejas, el tiene 30 años dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de ladrillos y también tiene ganado.
Don Santos tiene su clientela establecida, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo en donde siempre le llegan a buscar material de la construcción.
Don Santos está solicitando  el préstamo para compra de fertilizantes, tierra y leña para su así poder elaborar su ladrillos y almacenarlo para tener en existencia.
Don Santos su sueño es comprar más ganado y mantener siempre su ladrillera.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2013.
texts.en:
Sr. Santos is 60 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife in a community of San Lorenzo, which is in southern Honduras. Santos sells bricks and tiles. He has been making and selling bricks for 30 years, but he also raises livestock.

Don Santos has established customers. He conducts his sales Monday through Sunday, so he is always trying to acquire construction material. Santos is requesting a loan so that he can buy fertilizers, as well as dirt and firewood for making bricks that he can keep in stock.

Don Santos dreams of buying more livestock and always maintaining his brick business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, February 2013

loans.use: to buy dirt and firewood for making bricks, as well as fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Fanny De Lourdes

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Junín se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque se destila el mejor aguardiente en la provincia y en el Ecuador.

En este lugar vive la señora Fanny, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres de ellos son mayores de edad y la menor tiene 16 años y estudia en colegio, dos de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es empleado público.

Doña Fanny con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante  se dedica a la venta de sabanas, toallas, cortinas entre otras cosas, también realiza trabajos de bordados con motivos infantiles. Ella se desplaza por toda la localidad en su carro ofreciendo su mercadería y los bordados también los vende así o entrega en ciertos bazares de la ciudad, ella lleva 6 años dedicada al comercio y a sus bordados mucho más tiempo.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar toallas, sabanas, cortinas, telas  e hilos para sus bordados. Lleva 7 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque  con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es que su hija menor sea profesional.
texts.en:
The Junín Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Junín. This place is known for its friendly people. The best brandy in the province and all of Ecuador is distilled here.

Sra. Fanny lives in this place. She is 53 years old, married, and has four children. Three of them are grown and her youngest daughter is a 16-year-old high school student. Two of her children still live with her. Her husband is a public employee.

Doña Fanny intended to earn her own income so that she could move forward. She sells bed sheets, towels, curtains, and other products. Fanny also makes embroideries with children’s themes. She travels throughout the city by car so that she can offer her merchandise and embroideries. Fanny also sells and delivers her goods to certain bazaars in the city. She has been a merchant for six years and has been making embroideries for a very long time.

Her loan will be used to buy towels, bed sheets, curtains, fabrics, and thread for her embroideries. Fanny has been with the Communal Bank for seven years and enjoys being a member because one of the loans was used to start her business. Her dream is for her youngest daughter to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy towels, bed sheets, curtains, fabrics, and thread.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 31-year-old married woman who is the mother of two children. For the past two years, she has been successfully running a small general store with her husband from the corner of her house. Zahida's husband assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. 

Zahida is requesting a 30,000 PKR loan to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Née en 1982 à Sikasso, Fatoumata est une divorcée et mère de deux enfants  qui vit dans une grande traditionnelle élargie à Médine un des quartiers périphérique de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  Fatoumata s’est finalement initiée aux activités d’achat et de vente d’articles d’alimentation depuis maintenant plus de cinq années. Elle mène son activité devant leur  domicile à Médine Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de trois années et avec qui  elle a déjà bénéficié de six prêts qui ont été tous remboursés sans difficulté.
Ainsi, elle sollicite ce septième prêt pour acheter auprès de ses fournisseurs de Sikasso mais aussi de Bamako, 20 paquets de boisson NBB, 20 casiers de boisson BRAMALI, 40 cartons d’eau minérale, 10 cartons de lait Candia, 15 cartons de boisson en canettes différentes  (Malta, Vimto, Ivorio), 20 paquets d’eau minérale en sachets et des cartons de biscuits de qualités différentes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 170 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1982 in Sikasso, Fatoumata is a divorcee and a mother of two children who live in a large, traditional, extended [family] in Medine, one of the neighborhoods around the town of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the republic of Mali). 

After having tried many different jobs without success, Fatoumata finally opened her own shop, where she buys and sells food products. [She has been doing this] for more than five years now. She conducts her business in front of her house in Medine Sikasso, where she is highly sought after by her customers because of the quality of her products. To satisfy her growing number of customers, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. She has already benefited from six loans that have all been repaid without difficulty. 

So now, Fatoumata is asking for this seventh loan to buy from suppliers in Sikasso, but also Bamako, 20 packets of NBB drink, 20 cases of Bramali drink, 40 cartons of mineral water, 10 cartons of Candia milk, 15 cartons of different canned drinks (Malta, Vimto, Ivorio), 20 packets of mineral water in sachets, and some cartons of different quality cookies. 

She hopes to earn with this loan an average monthly income of 170,000 francs CFA, which will be used to increase her business capital, contribute to her family's expenses, and to pay the interest on the loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her food store

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
La señora María Estela  de  33  años de edad, tiene cinco  hijos que dependen de ella y de su esposo, vive con sus hijos y su conyugue  en su casa en la comunidad de  San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña María Estela se dedica desde hace 05 años  a la actividad de venta de de tortillas, sus clientes son los amigos, vecinos y personas que la visitan para comprar sus productos.
Doña María Estela solicita el préstamo porque quiere capitalizar su negocio comprando la materia prima que necesita para elaborar las tortillas como ser maíz, leña y cal.
Doña María Estela, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma 
Doña María su sueño es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2013.
texts.en:
María Estela is 33 years old. She and her husband have five children who are dependent, and live with them in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. María Estela has been selling tortillas for 5 years, and her clients are friends, neighbors, and people who come by to buy her products. 

She is requesting the loan because she wants to capitalize her business by buying the raw materials needed to produce tortillas such as corn, wood, and lime. 

María is very happy to keep working with Prisma.  Her dream is to improve her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - February 2013

loans.use: purchase corn, wood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es:
La señora María de 64  años de edad, vive con sus hijos en su casa, ubicada en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 12 años, al negocio de venta de ropa interior para adultos y niños su venta es ambulante.
Doña María  tiene un pequeño lugar cerca de la zona del mercado nuevo donde va todo los días a vender sus producto, es un cliente de varios ciclos y a demostrado fidelidad a la institución.
Doña María  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de ropa interior como blúmeres, braseares, calzoncillos, calcetines.
Doña María  está muy contenta de seguir siendo cliente de Prisma, su sueño es que sus hijos estén bien de salud.
 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2013
texts.en:
María is 64 years old, and she lives with her adult children in her own house located in the city of San Lorenzo. María has been selling underwear for adults and children for 12 years as a street vendor. 

María has a small place near the new market zone where she goes everyday to sell her merchandise. She has been a client for several cycles, and she has demonstrated her fidelity to the institution. 

María is requesting a loan to purchase underclothes such as panties, bras, underpants, socks.  

She is very happy to keep being a client of Prisma. Her dream is that her children will have good health. 
 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - February 2013

loans.use: to purchase panties, bras, underpants, and socks for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes, footwear, and a variety of stuffed animals for resale.

loans.name: G.s La Corteza#3 Group

texts.es:
El señor Isidro  es una persona  muy  emprendedora vive con  su esposa y sus   hijos en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es venta  de golosinas desde hace más de 3 años.
Don Isidro el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de refrescos,  carnes de pollo, res, pan, papas, patastes, plátanos, cebollas, chiles y condimentos. Con el crédito  espera  el aumento de sus ventas debido a que contara con más capital.
Don Isidro en unos años sueña con que su  venta de golosinas  este posicionado como la más grande y  reconocida de la zona y poder seguir apoyando a  sus hijos  a que se convierta en personas de bien  para la sociedad
