Don Isidro al igual que sus compañeros de grupo esperan poder satisfacer la demanda de los clientes que los visitan  y cubrir sus necesidades, así mismo desean que mejore un poco su situación económica y de su familia y que se vea reflejado con esta inversión. 
Don Cesario su negocio es  compra  y venta  de gallinas y granos desde hace 9 años. 
Doña Erika su negocio es  una mini-pulpería desde hace 5 años.



Choluteca, Honduras – Febrero  del 2013
texts.en:
Isidro is a very enterprising person.  He lives with his wife and children in a community in the south of Honduras.  His business for three years has been selling candy.

Isidro needs the loan to buy soft drinks, chicken, beef, bread, potatoes, chayote, bananas, onions, chili peppers, and condiments.  With the loan he hopes to increase his sales because he'll have more capital.

Isidro hopes that in a few years his candy business will be positioned as the biggest and best known in the area so he can continue helping his children to become good people for society.

Isidro and his fellow group members hope to be able to satisfy their customers' demand and cover their needs.  They also hope to improve their economic situation somewhat and that of their families, and to see this reflected in this investment.

Cesario has bought and sold chickens and grains for nine years.

Erika has had a mini-market for five years.

Choluteca, Honduras, February 2013

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, chicken, beef, bread, potatoes, chayote, bananas, onions, chili peppers, and condiments for his business

loans.name: Neiba Mariana

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar vive la señora Neiba, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada pero aun no ha podido tener hijos. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña Neiba para ayudar a su esposo y con esto contribuir con los gastos del hogar realiza el crédito para que él lo invierta en su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres para lo cual tiene un puesto en un Mercado de Manta, allí el trabaja todos los días desde las 05h00 hasta las 16h00 y lleva más de 8 años con este negocio, ella por su parte en su casa también tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en la cual se gana algo por su cuenta.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas, legumbres y víveres para surtir la tienda. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera del grupo y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es seguir aumentado su negocio que aun es muy pequeño.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products such as, for example, the Panama hats well-known inside and outside of the country, the members of the 4th of November communal bank meet every 15 days.

In this place lives Neiba.  She is 39 years old, is married but has not yet been able to have children.  Her husband is a merchant.

Neiba, to help her husband and with this contribute to the household expenses, is taking out a loan so that he can invest it in his business.  He works selling fruits and vegetables for which he has a stand in a market in Manta.  He works there every day from 5am until 4pm and he has been in this business for more than 8 years.  For her part, she also she has a small grocery store in her home in which she earns something on her own. 

This loan is to purchase fruits, vegetables and groceries to stock the store.  She has been in the communal bank from the beginning.  She is the treasurer of the group and she likes it because she started her business with one of the loans.
 
Her dream is to continue growing her business that still is very small.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables and groceries.

loans.name: Eliana Yanina

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar vive la señora Eliana, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 13 y 9 años que estudian en colegio y  escuela. El marido es comerciante. 

Doña Eliana realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo invierta en su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres para lo cual  tiene un puesto en un Mercado de Manta, él trabaja todos los días desde las 05h00 hasta las 16h00 y lleva más de 15 años con su negocio, los productos los compra en el mercado a mayoristas o si no a agricultores de la zona por donde vive con lo cual le queda mejores ganancias ya que les compra más barato, es así como gana el sustento de su familia y les da una buena educación a sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar legumbres, naranjas, papayas, limones y otras frutas. Lleva casi dos años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa bien terminada y más grande.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products such as, for example, the Panama hats well-known inside and outside of the country, the members of the 4th of November communal bank meet every 15 days.

In this place lives Eliana.  She is 30 years old, in a common-law marriage from which she has two children, 13 and 9 years old, who attend school.  Her husband is a merchant. 

Eliana is taking out a loan so that her husband can invest it in his business.  He works selling fruits and vegetables for which he has a stand in a market in Manta.  He works every day from 5am until 4pm and has been in this business for more than 15 years.  He buys the products at the wholesale market or, if not, then from farmers from the area around where they live, which leaves him with better earnings since he buys from them more cheaply.  It is in this way that he earns a living for his family and gives his children a good education.

This loan is to purchase vegetables, oranges, papayas, lemons and other fruits.  She has been with the communal bank for almost two years and likes it because the interest rates are lower than in other credit institutions. 

Her dream is to have a well-finished and larger house.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, oranges, papayas, lemons and other fruits.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is the married mother of two children who are both going to school. For the last six years, she has worked providing laundry services with the support of her husband, who is the man shown in this photo. Rehana started her business with little capital, but as her business flourished, she has been able to improve her business. She washes clothes in the machine and her husband assists her in pressing them. They have a large list of regular customers and are able to make enough to provide for the daily expenditures of their family.  

Rehana is requesting a 20,000 PKR loan through the Kashf Foundation to purchase packs of detergents and bleach in large quantity. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business and providing for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase detergent and bleach in large quantities

loans.name: Anwari

texts.en:
Anwari is a 57-year-old, married woman and a mother of five children. She works on a winding machine to wrap threads and wool onto spools and reels.  She has been doing it for about five years. She works hard on her machine every day, so she may earn a living for her family and provide food, health, and education. 

Anwari requested a loan of PKR 25,000/- from Kashf Foundation which she will use to purchase bundles of wool and threads in different colors, with some tools used in machinery. In this way, she would be able to inflate her sales which ultimately help in generating more cash. She hopes to have a good experience with the new loan.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wool and threads in different colors with some tools used in machinery.

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Né en Mars 1977 à Sikasso, Monsieur  Yacouba est marié et père de six  enfants qui réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Bougoula Hameau un des villages situé environ à 7km de la ville de Sikasso.
Monsieur Yacouba après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié aux activités d’achat et de vente des articles divers de boutique devant le domicile conjugal depuis plus de douze années. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a environ quatre  ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés ses 6 prêts précédents,  il sollicite ce septième  qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acquérir, 10 tonnes de maïs, 25 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 10 cartons du thé, 8 sacs du sucre, 10 paquets de lait en poudre, 10 paquets de bonbon, 15 paquet de Chewing Gum, 30 paquets d’allumettes et 15 cartons de savon.
 S’approvisionnant auprès de commerçants grossistes de la ville de Sikasso et environnants, il revend ses marchandises en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de toutes sortes de couches sociales de sa localité.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in March 1977 in Sikasso, Yacouba is married and a father of six children. He lives with his spouse and their children in a large traditional family in Bougoula Hameau, one of the villages situated about seven kilometers from the town of Sikasso. 

Yacouba, after having tried various jobs without success, started his own business buying and selling various goods in a shop. He [has been running] his shop in front of his home for more than 12 years. He is in high demand by his customers, because of the quality of his products. 

To satisfy his growing number of customers, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about four years ago. After having correctly repaid his six previous loans, he is asking for a seventh loan, which will allow him to increase his business capital in order to acquire 10 tons of corn, 25 packets of different kinds of cigarettes, 10 boxes of tea, 8 sacs of sugar, 10 packets of powdered milk, 10 packets of candies, 15 packets of chewing gum, 30 packets of matches and 15 boxes of soap. 

Yacouba procures his goods from commercial wholesalers in Sikasso and surrounding areas, then he resells his merchandise at retail for cash and credit to customers from his area who represent all walks of life.

With this loan, he hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA, which he will use to contribute to his family's expenses, pay the interest on the loan, and invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy grains and other various items

loans.name: Melania De Jesús

texts.es:
Doña Melania,  reside  en  el departamento de Masaya también llamada ciudad de las flores y merecedoras de mucha riqueza en todo tipo de artesanía.

Ella es viuda,  tiene la edad de 66 años,  comerciante, su nucleo familiar es de 6 ella y sus 5 hijos, actualmente ella vive con dos de sus hijos y que trabajan junto con ella, entre los tres se han brindado apoyo, de tal manera que doña Melania no se sienta sola, y del cual actualmente ella posee su propio negocio de venta de comidas elaboradas por ella misma, siempre a  buscado la manera de salir adelante,  ya que manifiesta que hasta donde Dios le preste vida ella seguirá elaborando  los ricos platillos nacionales de Nicaragua, entre los que menciona, sopa de res, enchiladas, tacos, cerdo y pollo frito, carne azada, acompañados siempre con el infaltable gallo pinto, y demás platillos. 

 Ella tiene su propio local en donde cada fin de semana de viernes a domingo por la noche,  se instala para ofrecer esos ricos alimentos, y del cual considera que esos días son los más productivos y es cuando tiene más demanda.

 Ella es conocida en la zona porque tiene años de vender ahí mismo, y sus clientes se sienten satisfechos con el servicio que ella ofrece. 

Actualmente necesita realizar unas compras  aprovechando la temporada de verano y que sabe que es cuando las ventas se ponen mejores.

 Por lo que necesita un financiamiento que le permita comprar  productos para la elaboración de comidas de todo tipo, arroz, aceite, azúcar, frijoles, harina y salsa de tomate etc. 

Confía en que el crédito le servirá de mucho provecho y así continuará supliendo las necesidades de su hogar, y le dará una mayor satisfacción para su vida.
texts.en:
Doña Melania lives in the Department of Masaya, which is also called the City of Flowers. It is a place with a wealth of all kinds of crafts.

She is a 66 year-old widow and a merchant. Her nuclear family consists of her and her six children. Currently she lives with two of her children who work with her. The three of them have helped one another to the extent that Doña Melania does not feel she is alone. This has enabled her to have her own business selling meals that she, herself, makes. She is always looking for ways to get ahead and says that as long as God gives her life she will continue making her delicious Nicaraguan national dishes. Among the dishes that she makes are beef soup, enchiladas, tacos, fried pork and chicken, and roast meat, always accompanied by her must have “gallo pinto” and other items.

She has her own place where, every weekend evening from Friday to Sunday, she sets up to sell that delicious food. She feels that those days are the most profitable and the time when the demand is greatest.

She is well known in the area because she has been selling meals right there for many years and her customers are satisfied with the service she provides.

Currently she needs to make some purchases to take advantage of the summer season when she knows her business will increase. Thus, she needs funding that will enable her to purchase all kinds of ingredients to make her meals, such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, beans, flour and tomato salsa.

Melania is confident that the loan will be very advantageous and thus she will continue supporting her household’s needs. Moreover her business gives her a greater zeal for life.

loans.use:
to purchase all kinds of ingredients to make
her meals, such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, beans, flour and tomato sauce.

loans.name: Duo Mujeres Aliadas Group

texts.es:
DUO MUJERES ALIADAS
Doña Juana,  es originaria de Tecpan, tiene 23 años de edad, tiene bajo su responsabilidad a su hijo de 3 años, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la crianza de pollos.
Desde hace algunos años ella viene realizando esta actividad, ya que es el medio que tiene para salir adelante ella y su hijo.
El sueño de ella es tener un negocio mas  grande para sacar diferentes estilos de tejidos ,  asi poder satisfacer a la necesidad de sus clientelas ya que asi podrá obtener mas ganancias, para poder mandar a su hijo a una mejor escuela para un futuro mejor. ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos.
texts.en:
Two Allied Women
Doña Juana is a native of Tecpan. She is 23 years old and is responsible for her three-year-old son. She works making traditional weavings by hand and raising chickens.

She has been doing this work for some years, since it is the means that she has to advance for herself and her son. Her dream is to have a larger business to make different styles of weavings and thus be able to satisfy the needs of her customers, since she will thus be able to obtain better earnings, so that she can send her son to a better school for a better future.

Juana is requesting this loan to buy the raw materials for her traditional weavings.

loans.use: to buy the raw material in order to make and sell traditional weavings

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 35-year-old married woman. For the past five years, she has been running a beauty parlor. Shazia started in one room in the corner of her house with a few things but has expanded her business and become famous in her street. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. 

Shazia is requesting a 20,000 PKR loan through the Kashf Foundation to buy a variety of cosmetics, some furniture (two chairs), makeup kits, and bleaching creams for her beauty parlor to meet the increasing demand of her customers. In the future, she hopes to gain more customers which will ultimately help to generate more cash.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, furniture, makeup kits, and bleaching creams

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is a 43-year-old energetic married woman who has five children, all of whom attend school. For the last ten years, she has been manufacturing "waan," a material used in making "charpoy," which is a bedstead of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs that is common in Pakistan. Ghazala offers various kinds of waan in different colors and has become famous for providing good quality waan in her community. She is able to provide for the needs of her family members. 

Ghazala is requesting a 30,000 PRK loan to buy another waan-making machine for her business so that her son can assist her in his free time.

loans.use: to buy a waan-making machine so her son can assist her in her business

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a 47-year-old married mother of two. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for the past six years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 35000 PKR to buy threads in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons, etc. to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy threads in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons, etc. to meet  the increasing demand.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is a 28-year-old vigorous, married woman and a mother of four children. She has a business of hand embroidery. She is passionate about her work and client demand is strong. Nazia’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the main earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 35000 PKR to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet  the increasing demand of her customers consistently. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. She would teach embroidery skills so they can help her expand her business and to also earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en: Nabila is a 34-year-old married woman. She has operated a beauty parlor for eight years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. By providing quality services, she has become very famous on her street. In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more varieties of cosmetics products for the parlor.  But because of low cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is on her sixth loan and has a good repayment history. She is hopeful to cater to more customers and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy clothes and shoes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Ligia De Jesús

texts.es:
Doña Ligia nació en uno de los pueblos blancos uno de los municipios mas bellos del departamento de Masaya,  que cuenta con unos de los miradores mas vistosos  de Nicaragua, como lo es Catarina.

 Ligia tiene 55 años de edad, de oficio costurera con 39 años de experiencia  y a la vez ama de casa, su núcleo familiar lo componen ella y su esposo.

Su negocio consiste en la elaboración de vestidos para niña estilo jardinera, vestidos de  quince años y vestido para boda, es una actividad que le permitió sacar adelante a sus tres hijas que son independientes actualmente. 

Su producto lo vende por encargo ya que tiene  clientes fijos y otros que son recomendados por sus clientes, doña Ligia también cuenta con un pequeño negocio que alquila en el mirador de Catarina. 

Sus compras las realiza en el mercado oriental de la ciudad capital, ciudad a la que tiene que viajar.
  En estos momentos esta solicitando un prestamos  ya que tiene pedido de vestidos de jardinera y la cual necesita comprar insumos como Organza Bordada, Tela para traje de novia, tela cambrellón, tela para foro, ciper termino medio.

Ligia también reconoce el valor que tiene su trabajo y uno de sus sueños es invertir en  maquinas industriales y así ser generadora de empleo para otras mujeres que desempeñan es este sector.
texts.en:
Ligia was born in one of the "white villages," one of the most beautiful municipalities of the department of Masaya, which has one of the most visited scenic outlooks of Nicaragua, called Catarina.

Ligia is 55 years old, and she is a tailor by profession, with 39 years of experience, while also being a homemaker. Her family nucleus is made up of herself and her husband. 

Her business is making sundresses for girls, dresses for fifteenth birthday celebrations, and wedding dresses. This work has allowed her to help her three daughters, who are now independent, get ahead in life. 

She sells her products by special order, since she has steady customers and others who are referred to her by her customers. Ligia also has a small business which she rents at the Catarina scenic overlook.

She travels to the capital city to make her purchases from the Asian market there.

At this time she is requesting a loan because she has an order for sundresses, and she needs to buy supplies such as embroidered organza, fabric for bridal gowns, shank fabric, fabric for linings, and medium sized zippers. 

Ligia also recognizes the value of her work, and one of her dreams is to invest in industrial machines so that she can create jobs for other women who are active in this field.

loans.use: to buy embroidered organza, fabric for bridal gowns, shank fabric, fabric for linings, and zippers.

loans.name: Duo Bendicion De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: DUO BENDICION DE VISTA HERMOSA el señor Ancelmo,de 38 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de ropa de vestir como pantalones, playeras, camisas, blusas  de damas y niños, también a la venta de ropa interior de niños y adultos. y gracias a la buena atencion que les brinda a sus clientes a logrado tener mucha demanda en su negocio, ahora el debe comprar muchas prendas de vestir porque debe surtir su negocios.  El ha comprado mucha ropa para el negocios pero no le son suficientes ya que los clientes le piden a él tallas y colores la cual no tiene todavía.  Por eso el se ve en la necesidad de hacer un crédito para la compra de ropa nueva en variedad, porque debe comprar más ropa y así no fallarle a sus  clientes que llegan a comprar a sus ventas.
texts.en: Ancelmo is part of the Bendicion Group.  He is 38, and works selling dress clothes such as pants, dress shirts, t-shirts, women's blouses as well as selling children's and adult's underwear.  Thanks to the great customer service he provides to his clients he has created a high level of demand.  He would like to buy many more garments in order to stock his business.  While he has bought quite a bit of clothing for his business it has not been enough, as his clients often ask for colors and sizes he still does not have.  This is why he is asking for a loan in order to buy a larger variety of clothing so that he does not let his clients down when they come to shop.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of clothing to stock his business and meet his clients demand

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 47-year-old widow who is hardworking and committed. She had a difficult time after the death of her husband. Four years ago, Rukhsana decided to start a business selling milk. She initiated her business by buying a buffalo to support her family, and as time passed, her sales increased and also her income. Now, due to her courage and determination, Rukhsana has two buffaloes. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. 

Rukhsana is requesting a 30,000 PKR loan to supplement her savings and purchase another buffalo. She expects boost in her business income as she expands her business. Rukhsana is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo

loans.name: Gulashan

texts.en: Gulashan had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for their better future. Ten years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. Therefore she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase another sewing machine with spools of threads and packs of needles. She has been in association with Kashf for three years and has an excellent repayment recordr. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the revenue for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine with the spools of threads and packs of needles.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is 32 years old and has been running a tailoring business for the past four years. She is familiar with the stitching techniques and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. To cope with the demands of her customers, she requested another loan of  25,000 PKR. With the loan, she would be able to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of buttons, laces and zippers in various colors. She is on her fourth loan with a good repayment history. Asia expects a boost in her earnings and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads along with packs of buttons, laces and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Mayra Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mayra es originaria de la histórica ciudad Darío la tierra que vio nacer al gran príncipe de las letras castellana Rubén Darío, Mayra es soltera su profesión es licenciada en administración de empresa, tiene un hijo en edad escolar.

 Esta señora se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, responsable con su trabajo y compromiso financiero ya que este es su tercer crédito, el cual ha demostrado honradez.

Mayra se desempeña como técnica de cartera y cobro de una empresa de acueducto y alcantarillado desde hace más de doce años.

solicita un financiamiento para la compra de una puerta de madera con tablero ya que necesita mejorar su vivienda. A la misma agradece el apoyo brindado por kiva y ceprodel ya que de esta manera aportan al desarrollo familiar
texts.en:
Mayra is a native from the historic city of Dario, the land that saw the birth of the great prince of Spanish literature, Ruben Dario. Mayra is single, she has a degree in business administration and has one child of school age.
She is hard working, responsible with her work and financially committed. This is her third loan, which proves her honesty.
Mayra has worked as a portfolio and collecting technician at a water conduit and sewage company for over twelve years.
She is asking for this loan to purchase a board door to improve her house. At the same time, she is grateful for the support from kiva and ceprodel, because in this way they contribute to the family progress.

loans.use: To purchase a board door for her house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Ms Asma is a 23-year-old unmarried lady who has worked as a seamstress for six years. She is experienced and proficient at sewing. Asma started her business with support from the Kashf foundation as she bought a sewing machine with her first loan. She now has a great client list, and has generated a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

Ms Asma is now asking for a loan of 15,000 Pakistani Rupees to buy a stock of threads in different colors, along with packs of buttons and needles. She would then always be able to meet the needs of her customers. Asma hopes to grow her business, and dreams of paying for the education for her siblings through her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors with the packs of buttons and needles.

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.en:
Abelardo runs a rice farming business in his village. He grows a large area of rice in his farm. Abelardo shares that, through farming, he is able to meet his family's needs on time and to send his children to school.

Abelardo is a patient father, who does almost all of the farming activities in his farm himself, just to minimize his costs in the farming business. Abelardo is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000. He will use it to buy fertilizers and herbicides and to pay for the labor cost, for harvesting his matured rice. Abelardo believes that the loan will be a big help to him for the continued operation of his farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides and to pay for the labor cost, for harvesting his matured rice.

loans.name: Sergio Antonio

texts.es:
Sergio es originario de la histórica ciudad Darío la tierra que vio nacer al gran príncipe de las letras castellana (Rubén Darío). Sergio es casado y tiene cuatro hijos en edad escolar, este señor se caracteriza por ser una persona de buenos valores comprometido con su familia.

Actualmente se desempeña como operador de equipo de bombeo en una empresa servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado desde hace doce años, con el salario que devenga lo destina para los gastos de educación de sus hijos y los gastos del hogar el cual se le dificulta realizar mejora en su vivienda.

solicita un crédito  para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como piedra cantera, cemento y el pago de mano de obra por la construcción de un cuarto de habitación.

Sergio agradece por el apoyo brindado por kiva ya que es la única manera que puede realizar esta mejora en su vivienda y a si poderle darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Sergio is a native from the historic city of Dario, the place of birth of the great prince of Spanish literature (Rubén Darío). Sergio is married and has four children of school age. He is a person of good values, committed to his family.
He currently works as an operator of a pumping system at a water conduit and sewage company where he has worked for over twelve years. He uses his salary to pay for the education costs for his children and for household expenses. This makes it difficult for him to make improvements in his home.
He is asking for this loan to purchase construction materials such as quarry stone and cement and to pay for the labor to build an extra bedroom.
Segio is grateful for the support from Kiva because it is the only way that will allow him to make this improvement to his home and in this way, improve life conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials: quarry stone and cement and to pay for the construction labor.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
With her determination to help her husband in farming, Lily engages herself in planting of rice in their field. Lily and her husband jointly manage their farm. They strive to give their children a better and comfortable way of living.

Lily is experiencing a financial shortage which prevents her from obtaining their farm inputs, due to increasing of prices of those inputs in the market. Lily is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy farm inputs, including fertilizers and herbicides for spraying, to avoid insects, pests and diseases. She hopes to increase her yield, while applying the exact amount of farm inputs needed in farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for spraying, to avoid insects, pests and diseases.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 42 years old, married and has a child. Her spouse is a farmer, and together they ensure good crop production. She usually gains income of PHP 15,000 each month and uses it as revolving capital in the farm, for bills at home and daily meals. Aside from farming business, she also operates a small store and sells grocery items. 

Ma. Luisa is now asking for additional capital of PHP 30,000. She will use it to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. These will help ensure good nutrition to crops. The loan will help achieve an abundant harvest in the farm, which is necessary to attain a progressive life someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Urbano

texts.en:
Urbano is proud to share that he is a farmer. Urbano plants and harvests rice in his village. It is his way of generating income to fulfill his family's basic needs. Urbano’s wish is to have a healthy body to be able to continue to operate his farming business. 

Urbano plants a large crop of rice in his field. Sometimes, he has difficulty financing his farm because of expenditures of the family. 

In this connection, Urbano is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase fertilizer and herbicides, to apply to his grown rice. He believes this loan will succeed with the business he has.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides to apply to his grown rice.

loans.name: Leonor Mercedes

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Junín se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque se destila el mejor aguardiente en la provincia y en el Ecuador.

En este lugar vive la señora Leonor, tiene 74 años de edad, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo 12 hijos los mismos que ya son  mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa con sus familias.

Doña Leonor con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante sin depender de nadie se dedica a la venta de sabanas, toallas, toldos entre otras cosas, ella trabaja junto a uno de sus hijos se desplazan a otras ciudades a comprar mercadería y realizar sus ventas, ella también vende bajo pedido que sus clientes le realizan con anticipación,  deja su mercadería a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Santo Domingo  cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene más de 15  años y es así como ella consigue su sustento diario.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar toldos, toallas y  sabanas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le han brindado. 

Su sueño es tener salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Junín Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Junín. This place is known for its friendly people. The best brandy in the province and all of Ecuador is distilled here.

Sra. Leonor lives in this place. She is 74 years old. Her husband died several years ago, so she has been a widow since that time. Leonor has 12 grown children and two of them live at her house with their families.

Doña Leonor intended to earn her own income so that she could move forward without having to depend on anyone. She sells bed sheets, towels, tarps, and other items. Leonor works with one of her children and they travel to other cities in order to buy merchandise to sell. She also sells by accepting orders from customers who submit their requests in advance. Leonor extends credit for her merchandise and collects payment every 15 days. She buys the merchandise in Santo Domingo every 15 days or monthly based on what is needed. Leonor has been in business for more than 15 years and continues to provide for her daily needs.

This loan will be used to buy tarps, towels, and bed sheets. Leonor has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and always enjoys the assistance that has been given to her. Her dream is to move forward in good health.

loans.use: to buy tarps, towels, and bed sheets.

loans.name: Lidia Azucena

texts.es:
La  señora Lidia  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con sus 2 hijos en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es venta  de  comida. 
Doña Lidia el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de carnes, pollo, papas, yuca, sal, pataste, manteca, arroz, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
La Doña Lidia espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de  los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona y que sus hijos  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida. 	




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Febrero  del   2013
texts.en:
Sra. Lidia is a responsible, hardworking, and honest person. She lives with her two children in southern Honduras. Her business involves selling food.

Doña Lidia needs a loan so that she can buy meat, chicken, potatoes, cassava, salt, chayote squash, lard, rice, and other items. She hopes this loan will increase her business sales since she will have more products to offer and be able to provide better service to her customers.

Doña Lidia hopes to provide for her existing needs and gradually improve her family’s quality of life. In a few years, she hopes that her business will keep growing and become of one the largest and most well-known establishments in the area. She also hopes that her children will become good people who have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – February 2013

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, potatoes, cassava, salt, chayote squash, lard, rice, and other items.

loans.name: Asociacion Sin Fronteras Group

texts.es: Socorro Benita es integrante de  grupo, junto a dos socias de éxito que conforman el grupo, ella es una mujer de 43 años casada, con hijos adolescentes. Desde hace cinco años su negocio es vender productos variados como sandalias de baquetas, sandalias de cueros, aceite menen, colonias perfumadas grandes etc. inicio vendiendo ropa ambulante. El crédito  lo invertirá en la compra de sandalias de baqueta, sandalias de cuero, aceite Menem, colonia perfumada grande, gel para caballeros, champo Palmolive, jabón Palmolive, jabón dove etc. Lidia tiene 55 años vende papel reciclado para envolver y Felipa mujer de 54 años en un mercado de la localidad vende verduras frescas.
texts.en: Socorro Benita is a member of this group and, along with two other successful partners, they make up this group.  Socorro is 43 years old and married with children, who are now in their teens.  For five years Socorro has been selling various products such as leather sandals, baby oil, cologne.  She started as a street vendor selling clothes.  This loan will be used to buy leather sandals, baby oil, cologne, hair gel, Palmolive shampoo and soap and Dove soap.  Lidia is 55 years old and sells recycled paper for wrapping items.  Felipa is 54 and sells fresh vegetables at a local market.

loans.use: to buy leather sandals, baby oil, cologne, hair gel, Palmolive shampoo and soap and Dove soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase industrial sewing machines and raw materials such as fabric, thread, elastic, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Jessenia Argentina

texts.es:
Muchos productos variados son los que exhibe en un estante a sus clientes Doña Jessenia, una humilde comerciante, originaria de Managua, acompañada, madre de 2 hijos. Ella a sus 32 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora que ha luchado por salir adelante con su  familia, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a una pulpería, desde hace 6 años, su nivel académico es  hasta primer año de secundaria debido a sus problemas económicos no le permitieron culminar sus estudios. Ella inicio su negocio con dinero que obtuvo de liquidación, ya que anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa y del dinero que ganaba decidió poner un pequeño  negocio en donde vendía helados, fresco, gaseosa y chiverías a la edad de 26 años,  luego decide establecer un segundo negocio como es su pulpería en su casa de domicilio para obtener ingresos extras y ayudarse con los gastos del hogar, negocio que saca adelante con el apoyo de su esposa e hijas.
Solicita el financiamiento para comprar productos tales como  embutidos, sardinas, arroz, azúcar, jugos, etc. ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar toda la mercadería necesaria para surtir su pulpería con productos más solicitados por sus clientes, uno de sus planes futuros es poder mantener estable su negocio para satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela y de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jessenia has a great variety of products which she displays on a shelf for her customers. She is a humble shop-keeper from Managua. She has a partner and 2 children. She is 32 years old and a very hard-working woman, having fought to help her family get ahead. She is a shopkeeper and has been earning her living from a general store for 6 years. She only went to school up until the first year of secondary school because of financial problems which meant that she was unable to finish her studies.  

Jessenia started the business with the money she obtained as redundancy pay, since she previously worked for a company. At the age of 26 she decided to open a small general store with the money she obtained selling ice-cream, fruit drinks, soft drinks and "Chiveria" dairy products.

Jessenia then decided to start-up a second business being a general store in her house, to obtain extra income and help with the household expenses. She has been moving the business forward eith the help of her partner and children.

Jessenia is asking for a loan to buy products such as sausages, sardines, rice, sugar, juices etc. She estimates that this loan will help her to buy all of the merchandise she needs to supply her grocery store with the products in highest demand by her customers. Her future plans are to keep her business steady to meet the needs of her customers and in this way obtain a better income.

loans.use: to buy products such as sausages, sardines, rice, sugar, juices etc

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана занимается продажей женской одежды. Также весной она продает искусственные цветы и венки. Прошлый кредит в КИВЕ брала на цветы. Больших изменений не произошло, но благодаря кредиту она смогла закупить новую партию одежды  и помочь своей дочери-студентке.

По словам Оксаны, прошлый год в плане торговли был трудным. Покупательская способность населения снизилась, соответственно уменьшилась прибыль. Но Оксана не унывает и надеется на лучшее.

Оксана просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 21,000 гривен на закупку искусственных цветов и венков.  Она планирует получить хорошую прибыль и закупить одежду к летнему  сезону.
texts.en: Oksana works in retail selling women's clothing. In spring, she also sells artificial flowers and wreaths. Her previous Kiva loan was used for flowers. There have not been any huge changes since then, but thanks to that loan, she was able to buy a new shipment of clothing and to help her daughter, who is a student. Oksana says that last year was a difficult one in retail because the purchasing power of the local citizens was lower than it had been, and as a result, her income decreased. However, she is not discouraged, and has hope for the future. Oksana is seeking a loan of 21,000 Ukrainian Hryvnya to buy artificial flowers and wreaths. She plans to make a good profit from them and to buy clothing for the summer season.

loans.use: to buy artificial flowers

loans.name: Hernán

texts.es:
Hernán de 38 años de edad, es sinónimo de pujanza y emprendimiento. Cuenta que su negocio ha crecido gracias a su disciplina y a miles de sacrificios que ha tenido que hacer.
Desde hace ocho años inició con la venta de comidas rápidas de manera ambulante en un carro de perros y al mismo tiempo comercializaba ropa.
Al observar que la venta de comidas comenzó a tomar auge en el sector gracias a la exclusividad de sus productos, Hernán decidió trasladar su negocio a un local para mejorar la calidad del servicio y aumentar el número de clientes. 
Hace un mes el área de sanidad realizó una inspección a su establecimiento, realizando algunas recomendaciones para mejorar condiciones sanitarias de su negocio, razón por La cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la adecuación del local con el fin de evitar el cierre de su negocio. Gracias a esta actividad, Hernán ha mejorado las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Su mayor deseo es seguir creciendo dentro del  sector de alimentos y abrir en un futuro cercano nuevos puntos de venta.
texts.en:
Hernán is 38 years old and describes himself as strong and enterprising. He says his business has grown thanks to his discipline and the many sacrifices he has had to make. 

Eight years ago, Hernán started selling fast food from a mobile hot dog cart. At the same time he was also selling clothing. Seeing that his fast-food sales were taking off because no one else was selling similar products, Hernán decided to relocate to a permanent store in order to improve the quality of his service and gain more customers.

One month ago, the health department inspected his establishment and made some recommendations to improve food safety and hygiene. Hernán is requesting this loan to help pay for the required improvements and avoid having his business shut down.

Thanks to his business, Hernán has improved his family’s living conditions. His greatest dream is to continue to grow his food business and to open new locations in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for required improvements to his fast-food business.

loans.name: Luis Fausto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 31 años de edad estado civil casado vive con su esposa tiene 4 hijos vive en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VCR Nuevos Horizontes, la comunidad se encuentra a unos 40 minutos en la comunidad santa Martha perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda.

Luis Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra y venta de naranjilla, Además se dedica a la crianza de ganado. Utilizara el dinero del crédito para comprar urea, herbicida, insumo para la naranjilla. 

Con el crédito que le otorga la cooperativa podrá aumentar la cantidad de la siembra. Sus compras las realiza en el cantón Guaranda. El sueño es llegar a crear un negocio de productos naturales. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan son el no poder comunicarse no tener medio de transporte en el clima y las plagas en los cultivos. En el tiempo libre se dedica a salir a la playa con los hijos y la esposa.

"Esta muy agradecida por el crédito anterior".
texts.en:
Luis is 31 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and four children in Guaranda, a canton in the Bolivar province. Luis is a member on the Nuevos Horizontes community bank, which is located approximately 40 minutes from his town, in Santa Martha, Guaranda.
Luis is a farmer, he grows and sells naranjilla. He also raises cattle. 
He will use the loan money to purchase urea, herbicide and inputs for the naranjilla crops. With the loan from the community bank he will be able to increase the amount of sown land. He makes all his purchases in Guaranda. His dream is to create a natural products business. The challenges he faces are lack of communication and transport, bad climate and crop plagues. In his spare time, he likes to go to the beach with his wife and children.
He is very grateful for the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase urea, herbicide, inputs for naranjilla crops.

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es:
María de 52 años de edad, se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer luchadora. Su familia es su pilar fundamental y la mayor motivación para ir en búsqueda de mejores oportunidades de vida. Casada y con cuatro hijos. Esta mujer aparte de realizar sus labores domésticas, también comercializa calzado. En un principio comenzó la actividad desde su casa, pero debido al incremento en el número de clientes se vio en la obligación de alquilar un local para la venta directa. Hoy lleva más de seis años trabajando en su negocio y cuenta que gracias a esto la calidad de vida en su hogar ha mejorado considerablemente.
Siente que el compartir los gastos con su esposo les ha permitido unirse como familia por lo cual se siente satisfecha y agradecida.
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de calzado, con el fin de tener inventario para las celebraciones de semana santa. Espera que con esta inversión sus ventas aumenten y su calidad de vida siga mejorando.
texts.en:
María, age 52, is known for being a tenacious woman.  Her family is her fundamental pillar and her greatest motivation to seek better opportunities in life.  She is married and has four children.

In addition to the domestic work this woman does, she also sells shoes.  At the beginning she started her business activity from her house.  However, due to the increase is her customers, she saw the need to rent a place for direct sales.  She has now been working in her business for over six years.

Thanks to her business, the quality of life in her household has improved considerably.  She feels that sharing the expenses with her husband has allowed them to unite as a family.  This makes her feel satisfied and grateful.

She is now requesting a loan to buy shoes.  She will do this in order to have inventory for the Holy Week celebrations.  She hopes that her sales will increase with this investment and that the quality of her life continues to improve.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en: Ms. Shakila is a 47-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for the past ten years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons. Her goal is to increase revenues so that she may generate more income. She is in her second loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Gofurjon

texts.ru:
Гафурчон пришел в МДО «Арванд» чтобы получить кредит для увеличения поголовья скота. Он женат и имеет детей. Его вид деятельности заключается в том,что он занимается скотоводством. Этим делом Гафурчон занимается уже несколько лет. Каждый год его скот к весне увеличивался, но в прошлом году он начал строительство дома и продал часть своего скота. Сейчас, он недостаточно накопил свои средства, чтобы продолжить развивать свой бизнес, поэтому он обратился в Арванд.
 На полученный кредит Гафурчон хочет купить скот и дальше развивать свой бизнес. От полученных доходов он постепенно планируют заканчивать свою стройку.
texts.en: Gofurjon has approached MDO Arvand for a loan to increase his herd of cattle. He is married and has children. He earns his living in animal husbandry, and has been raising cattle for several years. Every spring, his herd would increase, but last year he began building a house, and so he sold some of his livestock. To date, he has not been able to save up enough money to continue developing his business, and this is why he has come to Arvand. Gofurjon wants purchase cattle to further develop his business. He plans to use the income generated by this loan to gradually finish the construction of his home.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Fanny Dolores

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Junín se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque se destila el mejor aguardiente en la provincia y en el Ecuador.

En este lugar vive la señora Fanny, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo mayor de edad e independiente. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña Fanny tiene una tienda en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00,  también los fines de semana ella y su esposo  venden carne en los días la feria y aprovechan para vender los productos de su tienda. Tiene este negocio por más de 20 años y es la forma como han sacado adelante su hogar de forma honrada a base de su trabajo. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, carne y  otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco hace tres años y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del banco. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante hasta que Dios lo permita.
texts.en:
The Junín Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Junín. This place is known for its friendly people. The best brandy in the province and all of Ecuador is distilled here.

Sra. Fanny lives in this place. She is 60 years old, married, and has a grown son who is independent. Her husband is a merchant.

Doña Fanny has a store in her home where she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, legumes, vegetables, and fruit. She works every day from 6:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M. On the weekends, she and her husband sell meat at the fairs and also take advantage of this time to sell products from their store. Fanny has been in business for more than 20 years and her work enables her to make an honest living so that her household can move forward.

This loan will be used to buy more inventory for her store such as rice, sugar, oil, meat, and other basic necessities. Fanny has been with the Communal Bank for three years and enjoys the assistance she has received from the organization. Her dream is to continue moving forward as God allows.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, meat, and other basic necessities.

loans.name: Johana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Johana es originaria de la bella ciudad Darío, cuna del gran poeta Rubén Darío, estado civil es unión de hecho, tiene un hijo en edad escolar el núcleo familiar está compuesto por tres personas.

Esta joven se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora y muy inteligente su profesión es técnica en contabilidad;
Se desempeña como secretaria de una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado desde hace más de cuatro años.

solicita un crédito para gastos universitarios especialmente pagar el trámite de titulación en contabilidad.

Johana agradece a kiva por el apoyo brindado ya que le será de mucha importancia poder tramitar su titulo ya que con este documento tendrá más oportunidad de empleo con mejores condiciones salarial.
texts.en:
Johana was born in the beautiful city of Darío, birthplace of the great poet Rubén Darío. She lives in a free union and has a school-age son. Her family comprises three people. This young woman is hardworking and very intelligent. She is an accountant and has worked as a secretary in a water service and sewage company for more than four years. 

She has applied for a loan to pay her college degree fee in accounting. Johana thanks Kiva for its great support, which will allow her to receive her degree. Having this document will lead to more higher-paying job opportunities.

loans.use: to pay her college degree fee.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana,  solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio. Este le permitirá comprar  variedad de ropa para niños y niña, damas; también para adquirir artículos para una pequeña tienda que posee.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar el inventario. Las condiciones económicas mejoraron  y desea siempre darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Diana is asking for a new loan because she finds it necessary to invest more money in her business. This loan will allow her to buy a variety of boy’s, girl’s and women’s clothing and also items for the small store that she owns.
The last loan allowed her to increase her inventory. The economic conditions have improved and she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing and items for her small store.

loans.name: Los Castreños Group

texts.es: Richard, quien aparece bajo la lámpara; es socio del Banco Comunal Los Castreños, que está ubicado en Castro, X Región. En este Banco Comunal se encuentran distintos rubros entre los cuales destacan los invernaderos, mini supermercado, almuerzos, empanadas, colectivos, repostería y banquetería. El negocio de Richard está vinculado a los invernadores y viveros. Él lo comenzó hace dos años, producto de falta de trabajo estable, quiso buscar una alternativa por cualquier problema, así que opto por hacer un invernadero y cultivar plantas, además de enraizar murtas, que son de exclusividad para hacer mermeladas. Los problemas que ha tenido que sobrellevar son básicamente el no poder contar con los recursos necesarios para cumplir sus sueños y tener más dinero para tener un bienestar tranquilo. El préstamo lo ocuparía en comprar insumos para tener más plantas y además agrandar en pequeño invernadero con el que cuenta. En el próximo ciclo está muy positivo y muy seguro de que le ira muy bien ya que su señora ha podido hacer negocios y  optar a trabajos seguros a futuro. De trabajar con Fondo Esperanza está muy contento y agradecido de aprender cosas nuevas y muy entusiasmado para poder seguir avanzando con los ciclos del Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Richard, who is standing beneath the light, is a member of the Los Castreňos communal bank, which is in Castro, X Región.  There are different fields of work in this communal bank.  Among the different fields of work there are greenhouses, mini supermarket, lunches, empanadas, collectives, pastry making, and catering services.

Richard’s business has to do with greenhouses and nurseries.  He started it two years ago as a result of not having stable work.  He wanted to look for an alternative to any problem.  That is how he chose to make a greenhouse and cultivate plants.  He also grows murta berries, which are used exclusively to make marmalade.  

The problems that he has had to overcome are basically not being able to have the resources he needs to fulfill his dreams and needing more money in order to have a peaceful sense of well-being.

He will use the loan to buy supplies to have more plants and to enlarge his greenhouse.  He is very positive and very sure that the next cycle will go very well for him.  This is because his wife has been able to have businesses and choose secure jobs in the future.

He is very happy and grateful to work with Fondo Esperanza and to learn new things.  He is very enthusiastic about being able to continue progressing with the communal bank cycles.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his nursery and greenhouse.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bilma Casimira

texts.es: Bilma Casimira es originaria de la Ciudad de Somotillo, honesta, responsable, trabajadora, comerciante, cuenta con una tienda de ropa y calzado, es madre soltera  con tres hijos, a pesar de todos los inconvenientes que ha tenido  ha podido seguir adelante y brindarle lo mejor a su familia. su hijo menor esta Iniciando los módulos para optar al Titulo de Ing. Civil, por lo que se presento a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para suplir estos gastos y que su hijo logre ser un profesional.
texts.en: Bilma Casimira was born in the city of Somotillo. She is an honest, responsible, and hardworking merchant. She has a clothing and shoe store and is the single mother of three children. Despite obstacles, she has been able to get ahead and give her family the best. Her youngest son is beginning courses to receive his degree in civil engineering, and she has applied to Ceprodel for a loan to pay these educational expenses so that her son can have a profession.

loans.use: to pay for courses and degree fee.

loans.name: Silvio José

texts.es:
El Señor  Silvio José reside en la cuidad de las Flores, Masaya, casado, con 53 años de edad, su núcleo familiar lo componen el y su esposa, de oficio panadero.

Su negocio consiste en la elaboración de pan francés y pan dulce, tiene experiencia de 21 años, el aprendió el oficio por su papa, empezó como ayudante en la  panadería y al fallecer su papa se la dejo en herencia, el elabora el pan todos los días, lo vende en su casa y a otros clientes que le entrega por encargo, vende todo de contado y sus insumos  se los compra a empresas distribuidora de harina, mantequilla etc.

En estos momentos de su vida en la que ya formo a sus  hijos, trabaja en su panadería para el sustento de el y su esposa,  es una actividad que le gusta mucho realizar y que sabe que contribuye con la alimentación de sus clientes ya que el pan para los Masaya es unos de los complementos esenciales en el desayuno

Actualmente esta requiriendo de un financiamiento   para poder comprar harina, azúcar, manteca, mantequilla, levadura y leña,

Ya que la demanda esta fuerte y también le entrega diariamente el pan al hospital de Masaya. Considera que este préstamo le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos y darle una mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Silvio José lives in the city of Flores, Masaya. He is married and 53 years old. His nuclear family is made up of him and his wife. He is a baker.
His business consists of making French bread and sweet bread. He has 21 years of experience. He learned the trade from his father; he started as a helper in the bakery and when his father died, he bequeathed it to him. He makes bread every day. He sells it in his home and to other customers that make custom orders. He makes all his sales in cash and buys his inputs from companies that distribute flour, butter etc.
At this point in his life, when he has already raised his children, he works in the bakery to support himself and his wife. This is a business that he really likes, and he knows how to contribute to the feeding of his customers, since for the people of Masaya bread is one of the essential components of breakfast. He currently needs financing to be able to purchase flour, sugar, lard, butter, yeast and firewood, since demand is strong and he also brings bread daily to Masaya hospital. He thinks that this loan will help him to increase his income and make them more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, lard, butter, yeast and firewood.

loans.name: Freddy Hernan

texts.es:
Freddy tiene 32 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con la conyugue y con el hijo en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Vrc Nuevos Horizontes, la comunidad se encuentra a unos 40 minutos en la comunidad santa Martha perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda.

Freddy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y naranjilla, además cría pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insumos, abonos, fertilizante, balanceado, polvillo.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda cada semana.

El sueño es llegar a vender mayor cantidad de productos. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear por los alrededores vigilando los cultivos.
"Está muy agradecido por el anterior crédito".
texts.en:
Freddy, 32, lives in a free union and has a son. He lives with his partner and son in Guaranda province in Bolívar. He belongs to the communal bank Nuevos Horizontes (New Horizons), located about 40 minutes away in Santa Martha in Guaranda province. Freddy grows blackberries and oranges and raises chickens and pigs. 

He is applying for a loan to buy urea, supplies, manure, fertilizer, feed, and ash. The loan will let him buy fertilizer. He buys and sells in Guaranda each week. He dreams of selling more products. In his free time, he likes to walk through his fields, checking on his crops. "I am very grateful for my prior loan."

loans.use: to buy urea, supplies, manure, fertilizer, feed, and ash.

loans.name: Muhridin

texts.ru: Мухридин житель Гиссарского района, расположенного на центрально-западной части Таджикистана.  Мухридину 56 лет. Он женат и отец четверых детей. Один его сын находится за пределами страны на заработках. У Мухридин высшее аграрное образование и он работал по своей специализации 22 года. Последние 6 лет он занимается земледелием и выращивает овощи, в основном картошку. Одновременно Мухридин работает шофером грузовой машины и перевозит грузы. Мухридин обратился за кредитом для своей земледельческой деятельности. Он берет кредит для приобретения семян картофеля и минеральных удобрений. В будущем Мухридин планирует расширить свою деятельность и создать свое дехканское хозяйство. Дехканское хозяйство это небольшое индивидуальное или коллективное частное хозяйство, в котором работают несколько людей и где в основном выращивают хлопок, пшеницу или овощи - которые занимают 60% орошаемых земель в Таджикистане.
texts.en: Muhridin lives in the Gissar region, which is located in the west-central area of Tajikistan. He is 56 years old, married, and has 4 children. One of his sons is currently employed as a migrant worker abroad. Muhridin has a post-secondary education in agriculture, and he worked in that field for 22 years. For the last 6 years, he has been growing vegetable crops, mainly potatoes. At the same time, he works as a truck driver and hauls loads. He is seeking a loan for his crop-growing business. He wants to buy seed potatoes and mineral fertilizers. In the future, he plans to expand his business and establish his own dehkan farm. A dehkan farm is a small private farm owned by an individual or group that is worked by several people, on which the main crops grown are cotton, wheat or vegetables that account for 60% of irrigated land use in Tajikistan.

loans.use: to purchase seed potatoes and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 58-year-old, vigorous lady. She has been in the work of stitching for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues, so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fifth loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf Foundation for its tremendous support. Her pants and coat stitching is very popular in her area.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: La Sra. Mery tiene 46 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en un de las calles concurridas de la zona de Litoral,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Mery va a usar este préstamo para compra de material de construcción para la construcción de una habitación en su casa,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de efectivo para la compra de estos materiales,  La Sra. Mery enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las condiciones climáticas y también la competencia  de los demás negocios de comida por lo mismo que tiene que tratar de reducir sus costos y mejorar su sazón   de sus platillos, y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de utensilios  y también en la ampliación de su negocio para poder captar más clientes en las horas pico de almuerzo y cena, La Sra. Mery es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por esta oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Mery is 46 years old. She makes her living selling food in one of the busy streets of the Litoral neighborhood. 

This loan is Mery's first within the institution. She is going to use the loan to purchase construction materials to build a room in her house. Her reason for requesting the loan is the lack of cash for the purchase of materials. 

Mery faces challenges in her business, including weather conditions and also competition from other food-sales businesses, which is causing her to have to try to reduce her costs and improve the flavor of her dishes. She is going to use her profits to buy utensils and also to expand her business so that she can attract more customers during the peak lunch and dinner hours. 

Mery is a very hardworking person; she feels glad to have the opportunity provided by the granting of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a room in her house.

loans.name: Kouser

texts.en:
Ms. Kouser is a 30-year-old, vigorous married woman. She has been doing a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges and daily expenses frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is conductor, and does not earn enough to support his family well. Kouser is a mother of five children and is responsible to provide them with a good environment with good food, clothing and education. 

Kouser’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household.  She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy raw materials, such as thread, sequins and pearls in various colors and in large quantities to meet the increasing demand of her customers. She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in various colors.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Ms. Nasreen is a 54-year-old widow; she has been providing catering services with the support of her son for six years. 

Nasreen enjoys making food at home and has become famous in her town for providing these services. She takes orders from nearby hotels and people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. 

Nasreen is a responsible mother and needs to earn more to bear the daily expenditures of her family members. That is why she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy packs of oil, spices and salt in large quantity at lower rates from the market. This would enable her to cater to more customers time after time, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. Nasreen wishes to utilize her earned profit on her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy packs of oil, spices and salt in large quantity at lower rates from the market.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Матлубе 40 лет, она замужем имеет 3 детей.  Муж  Матлубы работал электриком, сама Матлуба тоже работала, но  сложилась так, что они оба остались без работы.  Муж решил  заняться откормом скота, так как это приносит хоть и небольшой доход.  Тогда дети были малы и денег хватало, теперь когда дети выросли расходов стало очень много и  они стараются работать не покладая рук. Скотоводство единственный доход в семье.
 Также они мечтают построить свой дом, так как они живут с родителями и им очень тесно. Матлуба  не хочет продавать скот, потому что, от дохода скота  они могут понемногу начать строительство дома. Для этого она планирует еще закупить  скот , чтобы  муж мог продать по дороже через некоторое время. Матлуба с мужем очень надеются на помощь от Арванд, в получении кредита и покупки скота.
texts.en:
Matluba is 40 years old, she is married and has 3 children.  Matluba's husband worked as an electrician, Matluba also worked but circumstances were such that they both lost their jobs.  Her husband decided to raise livestock as this brings in at least a small income.  Back then the children were small and there was enough money, now when the children grew up expenditures also increased and they try to work as hard as they can.  Raising livestock is the only source of income for the family.

They also dream of building their own house, because they live with their parents and it is very crowded.  Matluba does not want to sell the livestock because they can use the profits from the livestock to slowly start building their house.  She plans to buy more livestock for this purpose, so that her husband can resell it for a higher price after some time.  Matluba and her husband are hoping for loan help from Arvand to buy livestock.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora María Mercedes  es madre soltera de dos hijos menores de edad,  posee un puesto de venta ubicado en unos de los mercados de  León desde hace 15 años siendo este negocio el sustento de su familia.

Cabe mencionar que la Señora María Mercedes se acercó a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito el cual desea aprovechar la temporada de verano para invertir en la compra de productos enlatados como sardinas, atún y pescado secos, productos que son tradicionales de la temporada y su clientela se los están solicitando.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is a single mother with two minor children. She has had a stand located in one of the Leon markets for 15 years, as this business is how she supports her family.

It is worth mentioning that María Mercedes approached Ceprodel to request a loan, as she wishes to take advantage of the summer season to invest in the purchase of canned products such as sardines, tuna and dried fish. These products are traditional for the season and her clients are requesting them.

loans.use: To buy sardines, tuna and dried fish.

loans.name: Tanitra

texts.en:
Tanitra grew up as the youngest of three children in the small artistic town of Fairbanks, Alaska. She left home at the age of 18 to pursue her musical aspirations and to study clarinet and music education at UCLA.  She taught music classes in Compton, California, for three years while in school.  She noticed the large gap in music education programs available to students of color; they did not have any programs outside the UCLA students.
Tanitra’s four year old son is a strong motivator behind her passion to create musical opportunities for the community. When her son started to play an instrument, she could not find a suitable program without driving through LA traffic.  In 2011, she started the Southern California Fine Music Center (SCFMC) to provide quality music education through on-campus music programs in the Inglewood Unified School District.  Tanitra also provides education through parks and recreation programs, summer music camps, and private lessons throughout Southern California. She has assisted over 80 low-income children in the city of Inglewood. 
Now, because she has more students, she needs to move her music school from her house to a studio in Inglewood.  Tanitra will offer regular community music classes that introduce families to the possibilities of a music education.  Because her business is a start-up, she couldn't get a bank loan, so she approached PACE for a Kiva loan.  She will use the $9950 loan to buy musical instruments and lease the studio. 
The academy will offer classes for all levels of experience and ages, infants through seniors. SCFMC will operate two instrumental music camps during the 2013 summer in the Inglewood / Ladera Heights area, saving parents the long drive to other cities to enhance their child’s education through music.

loans.use: to purchase musical instruments for the students of her music school

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María Elena es una joven de 25 años, humilde de escasos recursos que fue criada solo con esfuerzo de su madre, la que le inculcó buenos principios morales y religiosos.

Labora como auxiliar de contabilidad para una empresa en el municipio de El Sauce desde hace cuatro años y da gracias a Dios por tener un empleo digno el que le permite costear sus estudios y llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar, ya que es ella ahora quien mantiene a su madre la cual ya no puede trabajar.

Su sueño es tener su título como contadora pública, actualmente está estudiando el último año de la carrera, por tal motivo solicita a Kiva para que a través de Ceprodel le financien un crédito para pagar el trámite de dicho título con el cual tendrá un mejor nivel social y por ende mejores ingresos.

Confía en Dios que su solicitud sea aprobada para poder cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
María Elena is a humble 25-year-old young woman with few resources. She was raised by a single mother who instilled in her good moral and religious principles. 

For four years, María Elena has worked as an accounting assistant for a company in the city of El Sauce. She thanks God for having a decent job that allows her to pay for her education and provide for her household every day, since now it is she who supports her mother, who can no longer work.

María Elena's dream is to have her Public Accounting degree. She is currently in the final year of the degree program, so she is requesting a Kiva loan through Ceprodel to pay the processing fees associated with her diploma. With her degree, she will have a better position in society and therefore a better income. She trusts in God that her request will be approved so that she can realize her dream.

loans.use: to pay diploma fees required to receive her university degree.

loans.name: Gladys Ernestina

texts.es:
La Señora Gladys Ernestina es madre soltera  de cuatro hijos,  posee un pequeño negocio de venta de comida variada  en el departamento de León desde hace 15 años, inicia sus labores a las 8 am y finaliza a la 7 pm de lunes a domingo con este mismo horario, siendo este negocio el sustento de su familia.

La Señora Gladys Ernestina se presentó a las oficinas de Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para realizar compras de productos al por mayor el cual ocupa para la elaboración de los distintos tipos de patillos y brindarle una gran variedad a su clientela.

Este trabajo lo realiza para aumentar sus ingresos de esa manera mejorando la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Gladys Ernestina is a single mother of four children. For the past fifteen years she has had a small business selling food, located in the department of León. She starts working at 8am and finishes at 7pm, working Monday through Sunday. From this business she is able to support her family. 

Gladys Ernestina came to the Ceprodel office to request a loan which she will use to buy products at wholesale price, to make various types of dishes and to provide her customers with a wide variety of food.
